loans.name: José Candelario

texts.es:
El señor José tiene 57 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida y dos hijos. Él se dedica a realizar viajes en su vehiculo, pero durante toda su vida ha sido agricultor que fue lo que su familia le enseño.

El préstamo que don José esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar hierro, cemento, arena, piedra y para pago de mano de obra, para realizarle mejoras a su casa que esta en mal estado.

Con la inversión podrá asegurar su vivienda ya que se acerca el invierno. Por lo que José busca que su familia este segura y cómoda. Además él comenta que trabajara muy fuerte para construir una casa de ladrillo y dejarle una buena herencia a sus hijos.
texts.en:
José is 57, and lives with his life companion and two children. He provides transportation with his vehicle, but he has been a farmer all his life, which is what his family taught him.

Jose is applying to Fundación Campo for a loan, in order to buy steel, cement, sand and stone, and to pay for labor. This is to carry out improvements to his house, which is in poor condition.

With the investment, he will be able to make his house secure, as winter is approaching. So José is aiming to ensure his family's safety and comfort. As well, he says he will work very hard to build a brick house, and leave it as a good inheritance for his children.

loans.use: To buy steel, cement, sand and stone, and to pay for labor, in order to carry out improvements to his house, which is in poor condition.

loans.name: Entesar

texts.en:
Entesar is a conservative person so she is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet, thus the man in the photo is her husband.

Entesar is a 46-year-old woman from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan. She has a wonderful business decorating with flowers and she is requesting a loan of 1000 JD to purchase materials needed for her business.

Entesar is looking to open a shop for her products to increase her income and her sales volume.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials needed for making flower decorations

loans.name: Maria Lilian Murcia Alvarado

texts.es:
Maria Lilian tiene 24 años, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 6 y 1 año de edad y vive con sus hijos en una colonia periférica de San Pedro Sula.
Maria genera sus propios ingresos ella tiene hace 3 años un negocio de venta de celulares y accesorios. Lo estableció al verse en la necesidad de no contar con un empleo que le ayudara al sostenimiento de sus hijos ya que no cuenta con la ayuda del padre. Ahora esta muy contenta porque cuenta con su propio negocio que obtuvo con sus propios esfuerzos. Su negocio lo tiene establecido en un puesto del mercado del centro de la ciudad en el cual le ha ido muy bien porque estos aparatos tiene mucha demanda en el mercado. Las ganancias que ha obtenido las ha seguido reinvirtiendo en el mismo. Ella trabaja 8 horas diarias.
Solicito un financiamiento con ODEF de 13,000 lempiras para comprar teléfonos celulares para que su inventario produzca buenas entradas de ganancias y también ofrecer variedad de modelos de celulares, así el cliente quedara satisfecho con el servicio.
Su plan en el futuro es llegar a tener un local acondicionado donde ofrezca la comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria Lilian is a 24-year-old single mother. She has two children, ages 6 and 1. Maria and her children live in a subdivision on the outskirts of San Pedro Sula.

She generates her own income through her business of selling mobile phones and accessories that she started three years ago. Maria started this business because she did not have a job to help support her children and she does not receive assistance from their father. Now she is pleased to have her own business because she can generate income through her own efforts. Her business is established at a market stall in the central part of the city. Maria has done very well because this type of equipment is in great demand at the market. With her profits, Maria is able to continue reinvesting in her business. She works eight hours a day.

Maria is requesting a loan from ODEF in the amount of 13,000 HNL in order to buy mobile phones for her inventory. This will produce good profits and also help her offer a variety of mobile phone models. As a result, her customers will be satisfied with her service. Her plan for the future is to have a suitable store where her customers will be comfortable.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phones to sell.

loans.name: Feryal

texts.en:
Feryal is a conservative person so she is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet thus the man in the photo is her son.

Feryal is a 48-year-old married woman from Irbid, Jordan. She sells clothes and she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase more quantities for business purposes.

Feryal is looking to save an adequate amount of money to improve her house and ensure her son's education.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for business purposes

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 42-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan. She is a tailor and she has a home-based workshop. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase materials and fabrics needed.

Amal is looking to establish a workshop away from her house, so that she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and raw materials

loans.name: Khaledah

texts.en:
Khaledah is a 39-year-old married woman from Al Salt, Al Balqa, Jordan.

Khaledah is looking to improve her family's living conditions, so she is requesting a loan of 700 JD to do maintenance on her house.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her house

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: La señora Lucia es una persona muy  trabajadora y  responsable la  cual se  preocupa  por  el  bienestar de su  familia,  desde   hace  tiempo se   propuso  realizar  mejoras  en su  vivienda, es  por ello que  en esta  ocasión se acerco  a la  institución para que la  apoyemos  en  su  proyecto , el  cual  consiste  en la  comprar ventanas y puertas  ya que  con las  que cuenta  actualmente  están  muy  deterioradas, agradece el apoyo  brindado  para  la  realizar su proyecto.
texts.en:
Sra. Lucia is a hardworking and responsible individual who is concerned about her family's welfare. For quite some time, she has proposed to make improvements to her home. This is why she has approached Credituyo on this occasion to seek help with her project, which will involve buying windows and doors. These items in her home have deteriorated.

Lucia is grateful for the support that will be given for her project.

loans.use: to buy doors and windows.

loans.name: Willian Ordoñez

texts.es:
Don Willian vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, es  una  persona  emprendedora,  muy dedicado  a su negocio, en  su casa de habitación desde hace mas de 8  años el tiene su tienda de abarrotes.
Don Willian Actualmente su tienda esta abastecida el préstamo  lo  necesita para la compra  de    café, azúcar, pan, refrescos,  harina,  lácteos, arroz, maíz, frijoles, y otros productos de consumo básico.
Don Willian Espera crecer más con el negocio y  así  satisfacer  las  necesidades  de  sus  clientes.
Don Willian sueña  en  tener un  mini supermercado y así tener mejores  ingresos  y  darles a sus  hijos una mejor calidad de vida y una buena educación.

Choluteca,  Honduras - Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Don Willian lives with his wife and four children. He is an enterprising individual who is very dedicated to his business, which is located in his home. His grocery store has been in operation for more than eight years.

Don Willian's store is currently stocked, but he needs a loan to buy coffee, sugar, bread, soft drinks, flour, dairy products, corn, beans, and other basic consumer products. He hopes to grow his business even more and satisfy the needs of his customers. Don Willian dreams of having a mini-supermarket so that he can generate more income and provide his children with a better quality of life and a good education.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Kholoud

texts.en:
Kholoud is a 32-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of six children. She sells cosmetics and perfumes and she is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase cosmetics and perfumes for business purposes.

Kholoud is looking to open a beauty salon and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and perfumes for business purposes

loans.name: Lucy Mburu

texts.en:
Lucy is a fifty-two-year-old lady; she is married and has grown-up children. She has a bakery and a livestock business in Kiambaa. She has been in the bakery business for one year now and gets a monthly income of thirty-five  thousand shillings.

 
This will be Lucy’s first loan from KADET LTD, and she plans to use the entire loan to purchase an oven and a dough mixer. With the profit that she will get she wants to expand the business. 

In future she wants to open a bakery in a busy town.

loans.use: to purchase an oven and a dough mixer

loans.name: Harison Mutinda Kithisya

texts.en:
Harison is 43 years old, married with four children. He does tailoring to earn a living. He has been in the business for 10 years and has employed three people. To earn extra income he does farming.

Harison describes his business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 100,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a tailoring machine and cloth.

loans.use: To buy a tailoring machine and cloth.

loans.name: Philis Utali

texts.en: Philis, a 31-year-old married mother of three children aged 16, 14 and 12 years, has been selling new clothes for three years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000. She is requesting a loan for KES 25,000 to purchase a bale of ladies' suits, her profits  from the business serving as her means of repaying the loan. Philis' dream is to establish her own wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of ladies' suits.

loans.name: Juana Victoria Zapeta Sapon

texts.es:
La señora Juana Victoria es casada, tiene  24 años de edad, cursó sus estudios de educacion básica, se dedica a la confección de playeras, inició este negocio como operaria y hasta el momento lleva 8 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la carpintería.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de telas, de diferentes diseños y colores, y así poder mejorar su producción de playeras, ya que espera en el futuro contar con un negocio amplio.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana Victoria is 24 years old and married. She completed her basic education studies. Juana makes t-shirts. She started out in this business as an operator, but now she has eight years of experience. Juana has the support her husband who is a carpenter.

She is requesting a loan that will be used to buy fabrics of different designs and colors. This will help improve her production of t-shirts. She hopes to have a larger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Daniel Makau Soo

texts.en:
Daniel, a 37-year-old married father of three, earns his living through carpentry. In business for over 10 years and employing three people, Daniel describes his business environment as favorable yet competitive, as there are many carpenters in the area offering similar services.

Since joining Faulu Kenya, he has been able to buy carpentry equipment, and hopes to expand his business in the future. Daniel is now requesting a loan for 90,000 Kenya Shillings to buy timber for furniture-making.

loans.use: to buy timber for making furniture.

loans.name: Susan Kamonde

texts.en:
Twenty five year old Susan is married to Robert and blessed with a two year old child. She owns a retail shop, a business she started two years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

She has requested a loan of KES 25,000 to purchase a sack of sugar, 50kgs of rice, a dozen of one litre elianto oils, and 10 packets of 1kg kasuku cooking fat. 

The profit earned from the business will help her repay her loan. Her dream is to see her business expand into wholesale. This is her first loan.
.

loans.use: To purchase a sack of sugar, 50kgs of rice, a dozen 1litre elianto oils and 10 packets of 1kg kasuku cooking fat.

loans.name: Deyba

texts.es:
Deyba, de 37 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.  Está casada con José quien es empleado y fruto de ésta unión tiene 2 hermosos hijos Rosa de 18 y Renzo de 7 años de edad a quienes quieren mucho, habitando cómodamente en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Deyba es la venta de abarrotes para eso cuenta con un bodega instalada en su propia casa, desde donde atiende a su clientes que en su mayoría son sus vecinos. Se incicio en éste negocio hace más de 2 años, por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso adicional, fue así que tuo un pequeño capital, fruto de sus ahorros, más un préstamo que solicito, y con ello lograron comprar mercadería en pequeñas cantidades. De esa manera ganó clientes. Considera rentable su negocio por las buenas ganancias que le deja y la buena acogida que está teniendo su negocio. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite estar en casa y contar con la tranquilidad de un ingreso económico, además del tiempo libre que lo puede emplear en el cuidado de su hogar. Pero no le gusta cuando sus clientes le solicitan créditos por sus compras pues comenta ya tuvo malas experiencias con éste tipo de venta llegando a fallar con el pago, por eso ahora se niega y todo lo vende al contado. Por tanto, y viendo los buenos resultados  tiene planes de seguir creciendo y ampliar su negocio. Este será el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero para concretar sus planes. Además de estar a gusto con su banco comunal pues conoce a sus integrantes y los considera ser personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes al por mayor buscando los precios  más bajos para así obtener mejores ganancias,  considera que a mayor cantidad y variedad su negocio seguirá teniendo una buena acogida y sus ganancias aumentaran.
texts.en:
Deyba, 37, is a hardworking woman with a strong desire to get ahead.  She is married to Jose, who is employed, and they have 2 beautiful children: Rosa, aged 18, and Renzo, aged 7, whom they love a lot.  They live comfortably in their own home.  Deyba has a business selling groceries.  She sells from a store that is set up in her own house.  This is where she tends to her customers, who are mainly her neighbors.  She started this business more than 2 years ago because she needed to have additional income.  She took some small capital that she had saved up, and together with a loan, she managed to buy some small quantities of merchandise.  In this way she attracted customers.  She thinks that her business is profitable because of the good earnings it gives her, and because it has been well-received by her customers.  She enjoys the business because it allows her to stay in her house and also enjoy the tranquility of having an income.  In addition, she can use her free time to care for her house.  However, she doesn't like it when her customers request to make their purchases on credit, because she has had some bad experiences with these types of sales when people fail to make their payments.  For this reason she no longer sells on credit, making all of her sales on a cash basis.  But as she is seeing good results, she has plans to continue to grow and expand her business.  This will be her 2nd loan with MFP, and she feels grateful for the financial support to implement her plans.  Also, she feels comfortable with her communal bank because she knows the members and considers them to be responsible and supportive people.  

With the sum of 1,000 Peruvian soles she requests, she will invest in the purchase of groceries at wholesale, looking for the lowest prices so that she can obtain the highest profits.  She thinks that with a larger quantity and variety of products, her business will continue to be popular and her earnings will increase.

loans.use: to buy consumer staples to stock her business

loans.name: Geoffrey Kariuki

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a 40 year old a business man, and he is married to Joyce, a business lady. They are blessed with three children. He has been a tailor for the past ten years with the monthly income of KES 15,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Geoffrey will use the loan to buy clothing materials for his business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a boutique shop.

loans.use: to buy clothing materials for his business

loans.name: Julius Kyalo Kitone

texts.en:
Julius is 36 years old and married with 3 children. He runs a retail shop to earn a living. He has been in this business for 11 years and describes his business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. He also does farming to earn extra income. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his business and hopes to expand his business to wholesale in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy sugar, rice, cooking oil and sodas to sell.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, cooking oil and sodas to sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 29 years old, and she does tailoring to earn a living. She has been in the business for 2 years and describes her customers as low-income earners because they live in the slums.

Since Joyce joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her living standards and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 15,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) to buy cloth material for making clothes.

loans.use: To buy cloth material for making clothes.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 32-year-old business lady, and her husband Anthony is a business man. They are blessed with one child. She has been rearing poultry for the past four years with the monthly income of 10,000 Kenya shillings (KES), which she uses to support her family.

Nancy is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a staff member. Nancy will use the loan to buy chicken feed.

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her child. Her hopes and dreams are to rear broilers (chickens raised for meat production), which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Janet Kathini  Musyoka

texts.en:
Janet is 41 years old and a mother of one child. She runs a grocery store to earn a living. She has been in the business for 5 years and describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition. She does farming to earn extra income. She describes her customers as low-income earners because they live in the slums.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Janet has been able to improve her business and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) to buy vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Vicenta Fermina Tzul Tzul

texts.es:
La señora Vicenta Fermina, tiene 22 años de edad, cursó sus estudios de educacion primaria, tiene un hijo, se dedica a la confección de pants, inicio este negocio como operaria y hasta el momento lleva 9 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de telas de diferentes colores, para mejorar su producción de pants, ya espera mejorar su negocio ampliándolo.
texts.en:
Sra. Vicenta Fermina is 22 years old and completed her elementary school studies. She has a son and earns her living by making trousers. Vicenta started in this type of work as an operator and now has nine years of experience.

She is requesting a loan that will be used for buying fabrics of different colors so that she can improve her production of trousers. Vicenta hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Merlin Noel Corrales

texts.es:
Merlín  es  un joven  muy trabajador,  dedicado a su negocio Venta de refrescos, jugos naturales y pan. Desde hace cuatro años y vive con su esposa y un hijo en   Choluteca  en  el  sur  de  Honduras.
Merlín vende sus jugos y refrescos en varias empresas agrícolas de esta zona sur de Honduras, negocio que es de alta demanda ya que es una zona con un clima muy caluroso.
Merlín hace sus ventas a domicilio desplazándose en su bicicleta y recorriendo muchos kilómetros para visitar a sus clientes. Merlín el  préstamo  lo necesita  para la comprar de pan, azúcar, frutas  como  tamarindo,  naranjas, moras, limones y cualquier otra fruta de temporada.
Merlín espera crecer con su  negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes ya que con más variedad puede llegar a muchos más clientes.
El sueño de Merlín es  comprar un  vehículo para  poder salir a zonas más  distantes y ofrecerle a su hijo una mejor forma de vida


Choluteca, Honduras - Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Merlin is a hardworking young man and has a business of selling soft drinks, natural juices, and bread. For the past four years he has lived with his wife and son in Choluteca, which is in southern Honduras.

Merlin sells juices and soft drinks to various farming businesses in the southern part of Honduras. His business has high demand since the weather in the area is very warm. Merlin conducts his sales at home and by traveling many kilometers by bicycle to visit his customers. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy bread, sugar, and fruits such as tamarind, oranges, blackberries, lemons, and other seasonal produce.

Merlin hopes to grow his business and satisfy the needs of his customers. By offering more variety, he expects to attract many more customers. His dream is to buy a vehicle so that he can travel to more distant locations. He also hopes to give his son a better way of life.

loans.use: to buy bread, sugar, and seasonal fruits.

loans.name: Joyce Gicuku

texts.en:
Joyce is a 55-year-old mixed-crop farmer, and her husband Patrick is a business man. They are blessed with three children. She has been practicing dairy farming business for the past ten years with a monthly income of 10,000 Kenya shillings (KES), which she uses to support their family. 

Joyce is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Joyce will use the loan to buy animal feeds. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 26 years old. He and his wife Pauline have one son who is 3 years old.

Joseph has a motorcycle business, which he has been running for the past 4 years. He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD. He intends to use that money to buy new wheels for his motorbike. He hopes to buy a new motorbike in the near future.

loans.use: To buy new wheels for his motorbike.

loans.name: Silva Alina Esparza Bravo

texts.es: Silvia se 19 años vive ( duran Guayaquil ) ella comenzó a vender comidas por quela mama la motivo  Haci que decidió ponerse un local donde vende comida y jugos. Trabaja todos los días con muchas ganas y esfuerzo. A futuro ella anhela arreglar su local. Con el préstamo comprara ( viveres como arroz, aceites ).
texts.en:
Silvia is 19 years old and lives in Duran, a section of Guayaquil. She began selling food at the suggestion of her mother. Therefore, she decided to open a shop where she sells food and juices. Silvia works every day with great effort and dedication. In the future, she hopes to make repairs to her shop.

With this loan, Silvia will buy supplies such as rice and oil.

loans.use: to buy rice and oil.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Fatou  est âgée  de 38 ans et vit au Sénégal. Elle s’active dans le commerce et la vente de denrées alimentaires dans le marché de la localité ou elle habite. C’est une activité qu’elle a choisi par nécessité dans le but de se procurer des revenus. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis 2006 et a déjà remboursé 3 prêts  antérieurs.  Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de denrées destinées a augmenter son stock de produits dans l’objectif de satisfaire la demande de la clientèle. Ce financement lui permettra d’accroitre ses bénéfices, de mieux se prendre en charge et aussi de soutenir son mari.
texts.en: Fatou is 38 years old and lives in Senegal.  She is actively involved in selling food products at her local market.  This is an activity she has chosen out of necessity, in order to have an income.  She has been a member of one of UIMCEC branches since 2006, and has already repaid three previous loans.  She is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs for the purchase of food products.  This will allow her to increase her stock of merchandise and to meet her customers' demand.  Thanks to this loan, she will also be able to increase her profits, better provide for herself, and help her husband.

loans.use: to buy food products for resale.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Fatou  est une femme de 34 ans  qui vit dans une des banlieues sénégalaises. Elle s’active dans le  secteur du petit commerce. Elle vend du jus de fruits et de la crème. Elle a choisi son activité dans le souci d’augmenter ses revenus. Elle est sociétaire dans l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC et 	a déjà remboursé un crédit antérieur. Le prêt est prévu pour acheter les produits  qui servent à préparer le jus et la crème qu’elle commercialise. Elle souhaite anticiper sur la demande de ses clients. L’augmentation de ses bénéfices lui permet  de mieux prendre en charge ses  besoins personnels  et de soutenir son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: Fatou is a 34-year-old woman who lives in a suburban neighborhood in Senegal.  She is actively involved in small retail business and sells fruit juices and cream.  She has chosen this activity because she wanted to increase her income.  She is a member of one of the UIMCEC branches and has already repaid a previous loan.  With this loan, she will buy supplies for the preparation of the juices and cream that she sells.  Fatou would like to anticipate her customers' demand.  With larger profits, she is able to better provide for herself and to help her husband manage the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy local products for the preparation of juice and cream.

loans.name: Juana Leticia

texts.es:
La señora Juana tiene 42 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene tres hijos. Ella tiene 20 años de dedicarse a lavar y planchar de otras personas que demandan este servicio en unas ciudades y en algunos caseríos cercanos a su comunidad.

Cuando no tiene trabajo de lavar y planchar, Juana vende empanadas, enchiladas, yuca salcochada o frita. La señora Juana toda su vida ha tenido que pagar el alquiler de su casa, pero el año pasado construyo su propia casa, por que un tío le regalo el terreno para que construyera la casa. Juana ya tiene varios años de ser cliente de la Fundación Campo y ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y muy luchadora. Del dinero que gana de planchar y lavar ahorra un poco para cuando no tiene este trabajo, ella va a la ciudad a comprar lo necesario para hacer las ventas antes mencionadas.

Ahora la señora Juana solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para instalar la energía eléctrica en su casa, de esta forma ella tendrá un servicio básico en su casa y le ayudara a incrementar sus ventas. Ella manifiesta que con la inversión ya no se le va a ahumar su casa con la luz del candil y ahorrara más, por que no tendrá el gasto de gas y la compra de baterías para su radio.

Ella piensa dejar de planchar y lavar más adelante, para comprar una refrigeradora y vender charamuscas, chocobananos, refrescos y golosinas.
texts.en:
Juana is 42, lives with her partner, and has three children.  For 20 years she been doing washing and ironing for other people who ask for this service in some towns and rural settlements near her community.

When she doesn't have ironing and washing work, Juana sells empanadas, enchiladas, and fried or stewed yuca.  All her life, Juana has had to pay rent for her house, but last year she built her own house because an uncle gave her a piece of land so that she could build the house. 

Juana has been a client of Fundación Campo for several years already, and has showed herself to be a responsible and very determined person. She saves a little of the money she earns washing and ironing so that when she doesn't have this work, she goes to the city to buy what she needs to sell the foods mentioned above.

Juana is applying to Fundación Campo for a loan to install electricity in her home. This way, she will have a basic service in her house, and it will help her increase her sales. She says that with the investment, she will no longer smoke up her house by burning candles, and will save more, because she won't have the expense of gas, or the need to buy radio batteries.

She intends to stop washing and ironing someday, in order to buy a refrigerator and sell charamuscas and chocobananos (both are Salvadoran frozen treats), as well as soft drinks and candy.

loans.use: To install electricity in her home.

loans.name: Angel Alberto Mezon Lino

texts.es: Angel de 43 años vive ( manta ecuador). El aprendió este oficio de soldador desde muy pequeño. El decidió poner en practica este oficio para ´poder sacar adelante a su familia. Trabaja con muchas ganas y esfuerzo todos los días solo. A futuro el anhela sacar adelante a su  familia y mejorar su negocio. Con el préstamo comprara ( soldadura puertas etc)-
texts.en:
Angel, age 43, lives in Manta, Ecuador.  He learned the soldering trade when he was very young.  He decided to practice this trade in order to get his family ahead.  He works alone every day with a great desire and a lot of effort.

In the future he wishes to get his family ahead and to improve his business.  He will use the loan to buy welding materials for doors, etc.

loans.use: to buy soldering materials for doors.

loans.name: Luisa Pilar Alvarez Villasagua

texts.es: Luisa d e 43 años vive ( duran ecuador ). Ella siempre desde muy pequeña a sido comerciante. Decdio el oficio de vender cremas y perfumes para asi mejorar sus ingresos . trabaja todos los días con su hija . a futuro ella anhela remodelar su casa. Con el préstamo comprara ( perfumes cremas ).
texts.en:
Luisa, age 43, lives in Duran, Ecuador.  Ever since she was a little girl she has always wanted to be a merchant.  She decided on the occupation of selling creams and perfumes in order to improve her income.  She works every day with her daughter.

In the future she wishes to remodel her house.  She will use the loan to buy perfumes and creams.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and creams.

loans.name: Yiye Tony Toala Quiroz

texts.es: Yiye de 23 años vive ( libertad ecuador ). El desde muy pequeño veía al padre como trabajaba  y el aprendió. El decdio ponerse el negocio de ser ebanista y lo logro le va bien. Trabaja todos los días con ganas y esfuerzo solo después que viene de la universidad. A futuro el desea tener un local grande y tener personal. Con el prestamo comprara ( sillas puertas etc).
texts.en:
Yiye, age 23, lives in Libertad, Ecuador.  When he was very young he watched how his father worked, and he learned. 

He decided to establish the business of being a cabinetmaker.  He managed to do that, and it is going well for him.  After returning from the university he works alone every day with great desire and effort. 

In the future he wishes to have a large place, and he wishes to have personnel.  He will use the loan to buy chairs and doors, etc.

loans.use: to buy chairs and doors, etc.

loans.name: Maritza Del Pilar Alvarado Moreira

texts.es: Maritza de 49 años vive ( isla guayaquil ). ella aprendio a ser costura en unos cursos que hacian por su barrio. y decidio ponerce el negocio de costura. cuando no tiene trabajo de costura se dedica a trabajar en su casa vendiendo jugos . a futuro anhela contruir su casa y combertirse en modista. con el prestamo comprara (material de costura, tales como hilos, tijeras, herramientas ).
texts.en:
Maritza, age 49, lives in Isla, Guayaquil.  She learned to be a seamtress from some courses that were given in her neighborhood.  She decided to set up a seamstress business.

When she does not have sewing work she works in her house selling juices.  In the future she wishes to build her house and to become a dressmaker.

She will use the loan to buy sewing materials like thread, scissors, and tools.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials like thread, scissors, and tools.

loans.name: Ana Cristina Milla Giron

texts.es:
Ana Cristina tiene 22 años de edad, es casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, con el cual procreo 2 hijos de 3 y 1 año de edad, y vive en el municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa.
Ana cuenta con un negocio de una pulpería que estableció hace 3 años con sus propios medios. Ella quería trabajar en una actividad que le permitiera siempre estar al cuidado de sus hijos.  Fue entonces que pensó trabajar en lo propio instalando la pulpería donde ofrece a sus clientes productos alimenticios como harina, azúcar, manteca, arroz, frijoles, carnes, lácteos, refrescos entre otros. Manifiesta que tiene muchos clientes y que desde que empezó su negocio ha mejorado poco a poco con la ayuda de los financiamientos que ha recibido por parte de ODEF.  Ella atiende su negocio todos los días de la semana y desde muy temprano para darles buen servicio a sus clientes.
Esta solicitando su tercer préstamo de 26,000 lempiras para comprar más productos alimenticios como granos básicos, lácteos, refrescos etc. Con esta inversión ella lograra ofrecer variedad de producto a su clientela y mejorar sus ingresos.
Su plan es seguir superándose en su negocio para seguir generando los ingresos que hasta ahora le han permitido sostener a sus hijos y también tener la solvencia económica para el futuro ellos puedan estudiar.
texts.en:
Ana Cristina, age 22, is married, and her husband is a farmer.  They have two children, ages 3 and 1.  She lives in the Santa Cruz de Yojoa municipality.

Ana has a business, a grocery store that she established three years ago with her own means.  She wanted to work at a business activity that would allow her to be there to take care of her children.  That was when that she thought of working independently.  She set up her store where she offers her customers food products like flour, sugar, lard, rice, beans, meat, dairy products, and soft drinks, among others.

She says that she has a lot of customers.  Since she started her business it has improved, little by little, with the help of the loans she has received from ODEF.  She tends to her business every day of the week.  She starts very early in order to give her customers good service. 

She is requesting her third loan for 26,000 lempiras to buy more food products like basic grains, dairy products, and soft drinks, etc.  With this investment she will manage to offer a variety of products to her clientele and to improve her income.

Her plan is to continue improving in her business. She will do this in order to continue generating the income that has so far allowed her to support her children.  She will also do this to have financial solvency so that her children will be able to go to school in the future.

loans.use: to buy more food products like basic grains, dairy products, and soft drinks, etc. to stock her business.

loans.name: Maurice Ochieng  Nyawira

texts.en: Maurice is 31 years old and married with 2 children. He runs a barber shop to earn a living. He has been in the business for 3 years and describes his customers as low income earners because they live in the slums. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to provide for his family and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy two shaving machines.

loans.use: to buy  two shaving machines.

loans.name: Felicita Elena Florez Reyes

texts.es: Felicita  de 48   años vive ( libertad ecuador ). Ella comenzó este negocio con una tienda muy pequeña por el motivo de que por su barrio no había tienda. Al pasar el tiempo le va bien y a logrado engrandarla un poco.  Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación trabaja todos los días con su hija .a  futuro ella anhela tener una despensa. Con el préstamo comprara ( bebidas, snacks, papeleria).
texts.en:
Felicita, 48, lives in Libertad, Ecuador.  She began this business with a very little store because there was not a store in her neighborhood.  As time goes by it is going well for her and she has managed to enlarge it a little.  With a lot of effort and dedication she works every day with her daughter.  In the future she wants to have a store.

With the loan she will buy beverages, snacks, and stationery.

loans.use: to buy beverages, snacks, and stationery.

loans.name: Narcisa Piedad Moran Pozo

texts.es: Narcisa de 31 años vive ( suburbio guayaquil ). Ella empezó su negocio vendiendo perfumes de Yambal por una amiga que le dijo que se incriva y lo hizo . el motivo de escoger este negocio  es por mejorara su situación economica.y para poder sustentar a sus hijos decidió vender Yambal. Ella trabaja con muchas ganas y esfuerzo todos los días . A futuro ella anhela mejorara su negocio y su situación económica. Con el préstamo comprara ( joyas perfumes, cremas etc).
texts.en:
Narcisa, 31, lives in a suburb of Guayaquil.  She began her business selling perfumes from Yambal because a friend told her to sign up and she did.  The reason she chose this business is to improve her financial situation and be able to support her children.  She decided to sell Yambal.

She works with a lot of desire and effort every day.  In the future she wants to improve her business and her financial situation.

With the loan she will buy jewelry, perfume, cream, etc.

loans.use: to buy perfume and creams.

loans.name: Divinas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Divinas está integrado por siete mujeres trabajadoras, que decidieron llamarse así porque ellas mismas se califican como “divinas”.
Una de las integrantes de llama Martha Alicia de 34 años, casada y con tres hijos que actualmente están estudiando (18, 11 y 6 años), tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa. Hace unos 6 años aproximadamente ella trabajaba en un depósito, como no tenía quien le ayudara a cuidar a todos sus hijos se llevaba a la más pequeña al trabajo. El lugar donde laboraba estaba ubicado en una avenida grande por lo que la niña jugaba cerca de los carros que transitaban por ahí; Alicia se preocupaba por la seguridad de su hija por lo que decidió salirse de ahí y poner una tienda en su casa. 
Martha sueña con comprar una copiadora y establecer una papelería, ya que por donde vive no hay este tipo de establecimientos, más delante comprar un plotter. Con el crédito quiere surtir más mercancía para incrementar las ventas y expandir la tienda.
texts.en: The Divinas (Divine) group consists of seven hard-working women who decided to call the group that because they consider themselves "divine." One of the members is Martha Alicia, a 34-year-old married mother of three children who are in school (ages 18, 11 and 6). She runs a grocery store out of her home. About six years ago she was working at a warehouse, and because she didn't have any help taking care of her kids she had to take on the least amount of work. The place where she worked was located on a big avenue, so her young daughter played near to where the cars were passing by. Martha Alicia was worried about her daughter's security, so she decided to leave her work and set up a store in her house. She dreams of buying a copy machine and establishing a stationery store, since there isn't this type of business where she lives. Later on, she wants to purchase a plotter (high-powered printer). With the loan she is requesting, she wants to stock her store with more merchandise to increase her sales and expand her shop.

loans.use: to purchase grocery supplies to increase sales and expand her store.

loans.name: David Mwangi

texts.en:
David is 30 years old and married. He sells second-hand clothes and shoes, a business he has been doing for the past seven years and earns a monthly income of KES.19,500. 

He is requesting for a loan of KES 15,000 to purchase clothes and shoes for selling. The profit he earns from his business will help him open up his own shop. His dream is to have a brighter future a head. This is his first loan.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and shoes for selling.

loans.name: Jane Wanjiku

texts.en:
Jane is 53 years old and a mixed crop farmer. She is married to Francis a business man. They are blessed with four children. She has been a farmer for the past 15 years with the monthly income of KES 17,000 which she uses to support her family.


She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Jane will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to venture into dairy farming.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Amédodé

texts.fr:
Amédodé est une femme âgé(e) de 53 ans. Elle est mariée å un agent au Port Autonome de Lomé et a 02 enfants dont 01 à l'école. Le premier a 22ans et le dernier 18ans.
Amédodé travaille comme revendeuse de poissons frais dans un quartier de la place et s’approvisionne à Lomé. L’activité qu’elle a démarrée en 1985.  Elle est a son huitième crédit(le remboursement a été fait sans problème) de WAGES.
Dans les prochaines années, Amédodé voudrait réinvestir dans son activité, augmenter son revenu et améliorer le niveau de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Amédodé is a 53-year-old woman.  She is married to a Port of Lomé agent and has two children of whom one is in school.  The eldest of her children is 22 years old, and the youngest 18.  

Amédodé works selling fresh fish in a section of the marketplace and stocks up in Lomé.  She started this business in 1985.  She is asking for her eighth loan (the previous repayments were made without any problems) from WAGES.

In the coming years, Amédodé would like to reinvest in her business, increase her profits, and improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 38 years old and married to Mark.They are blessed with four children ages 17, 15, nine and seven years respectively. She is a farmer, a practice she ventured into seven years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

She has requested a loan of KES 35,000 to purchase fertilizer and seeds in preparation for the planting season. The profit she gets will help her improve her farming as well as her living standard. 

She hopes to lead a good life. This is her sixth loan.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer in preparation for the planting season.

loans.name: Elizabeth Mwikali Mutiso

texts.en: Elizabeth is 27 years old. She sells clothes to earn a living. She has been in the business for 8 years and has employed one person. She describes her business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her living standards and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy clothes for selling.

loans.use: to buy clothes for selling.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad has a small coffee shop. He is requesting a loan of 600 Jordanian dinars to purchase goods for his shop such as coffee and sugar. Mohammad is looking to expand his shop and increase his income. Mohammad is a 43-year-old married man from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan, and the father of two children.

loans.use: to purchase goods for his business (coffee, sugar).

loans.name: Hanadi

texts.en: Hanadi sells used clothes. She is requesting a loan of 400 Jordanian dinars to purchase larger quantities for trading purposes. Hanadi is a 31-year-old woman from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan. She is looking to increase her income and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase used clothes for trading purposes

loans.name: Etrancia Mwamburi

texts.en:
Etrancia is a 58-year-old retail shop owner in Voi. She is a married mother of four. She has been a shopkeeper for the past six years. She also does poultry and dairy farming to supplement her income. Her business is doing great.

This marks her first borrowing from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase more sugar, salt, cooking oil, and washing detergent. 

She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business further and to repay her loan. She hopes to have a well established business.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, salt, cooking oil, and washing detergent.

loans.name: Artur Carlos Muguerane

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito Massinga, Província de inhambane, Sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 3 filhos todos frequentam a Escola. Fez a 7ª classe e parou quando foi entregado ao serviço militar obrigatório. Vive  na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta seu pai que vive com ele. 
	

 Trabalha como guarda da CMC há mais de 7 anos e também pensionista militar há 8 anos onde tem 4.850.00mt como guarda e 1.930.00mt de pensão este valor aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BARCLAYS).

Já teve empréstimo no TCHUMA e conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades, conheceu a Hluvuku através de um amigo que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu quarto empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 17.500.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa ( areia, cimento, ferro, pedra, e outros). Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 8.000.00mt, 12.000.00mt e 15.000.00mt aplicados na habitação. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a sua casa, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Artur Carlos was born in the district of Massinga in the province of Inhambane in southern Mozambique.  He is married and is the father of three children, all of whom are in school.  He studied through seventh grade and stopped because he was enrolled in mandatory military service.  He lives in his own home with his family and also supports his father, who lives with him.

He has worked as a guard at CMC for more than seven years.  He has also received a military pension for eight years.  He makes 4,850 meticals as a guard and 1,930 meticals from his pension.  He applies this money to his home's expenses and also saves some in his bank account at the Barclays bank.

He has already had a loan with the TCHUMA bank, which he paid back without any problems.  He became familiar with Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of the institution.  This is his fourth loan with Hluvuku for 17,500 meticals, which he will use to buy construction materials for his home (sand, cement, iron, stone, etc.).  His previous loans were for 8,000, 12,000, and 15,000 meticals, all of which were applied to his home.  He promises to make all of his payments on time.  In the future, he wants to finish his home, for which he plans on requesting more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for his home (sand, cement, iron, stones,  etc.).

loans.name: Aurelia Favasse Utui

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 3 filhos todos frequentam a Escola. Fez a 5ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta a sua mãe que vive com ela. 
		
	
Trabalha como operária da bananalândia há mais de 5 anos e tem um salário de 2.400.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BIM).
	
Nunca teve empréstimos noutros, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa (pedra, areia, cimento, ferro, e outros). Os empréstimos anteriores foram ambos de 10.000.00mt, aplicados na habitação.  
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a sua casa e mobilar, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Aurelia Favasse was born in the district of Boane in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique.  She is a single mother of three children, all of whom are in school.  She studied through the fifth grade and stopped due to her parents' lack of financial resources.  She lives in her own home with her family and also supports her mother, who lives with her.

She has worked at Bananalândia for more than five years.  She makes 2,400 meticals, which she puts towards her home's expenses.  She also saves some in her bank account at the BIM bank.

She has never had a loan with another bank.  She became familiar with Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of the institution.  This is her third loan with Hlvuku, and it is for 10,000 meticals.  She will use it to buy construction materials for her home (stone, sand, cement, iron, etc.).  Her previous loans were both for 10,000, and they were applied to her home.

She promises to make her payments on time.  In the future, she wants to finish her home and furnish it, for which she plans on requesting more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her home (stone, sand, cement, iron, etc.).

loans.name: Aventina Jose Simango

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Manjacaze, Província de Gaza, Sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 4 filhos todos frequentam a Escola. Fez a 6ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 
	
	
Saiu de Manjacaze para Maputo no Distrito de Boane quando casou. É negociante há mais de 5 anos dedica-se a venda de produtos diversos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 12.000.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BIM).
	
Nunca teve empréstimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa (cimento, areia, pedra, ferro, e outros). O empréstimo anterior foi de 15.000.00mt, aplicados na habitação. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a sua casa e mobilar, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Aventina Jose was born in the district of Manjacaze in the province of Gaza in southern Mozambique.  She is married and is the mother of four children, all of whom go to school.  She studied through the sixth grade and stopped due to her parents' lack of financial resources.  She lives in her own home with her family and doesn't support anyone besides them.

She left Manjacaze for Maputo in the district of Boane when she got married.  She has had a business selling various products for more than five years.  She has an income of 12,000 meticals, which she puts towards her home's expenses.  She also saves some in her bank account at the BIM bank.

She has never had a loan with another bank.  She became familiar with Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of the institution.  This is her second loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which she will use to buy construction materials for her home (cement, sand, stone, iron, etc.).  Her previous loan was for 15,000 meticals, and it was applied to her home.

She promises to make her payments on time.  In the future, she wants to finish her home and furnish it, for which she plans on requesting more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, stone, iron, etc., for the continued construction of her home.

loans.name: Ashiraf

texts.en:
Ashiraf is 28 years old. He operates a produce business, which he has run for a period of 4 years. Ashiraf began as a harvester of beans and maize. He then started his produce business, which has improved steadily. Ashiraf wants a loan to buy maize, beans and groundnuts to sell.

Price fluctuations and inadequate capital have been factors that affect the growth of his business. He has a dream of building a permanent home. He wishes to expand his business to other new markets and buy land for growing crops.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans and groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Celeste Langa

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Cidade da Matola, Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 4 filhos dos quais 3 frequentam a Escola e o outro ainda menor. Fez a 8ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 
	
	
É negociante há mais de 14 anos dedica-se a venda de produtos diversos tem um rendimento de cerca de 3.000.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BIM).
	
Nunca teve empréstimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria (arroz, óleo, feijão, amendoim, e outros). O empréstimo anterior foi de 10.000.00mt, aplicado no negócio.  
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende ampliar o negócio diversificando ainda mais os seus produtos, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Celeste was born in the city of Matola in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique.  She is married and is the mother of four children, three of whom are in school.  The other one is still too young.  She studied through eighth grade and stopped due to her parents' lack of financial resources.  She lives in her own home with her family and doesn't support anyone else besides them.

She has had a business selling various products for more than fourteen years.  She makes almost 3,000 meticals, which she puts towards her home's expenses.  She also saves some in her bank account at the BIM bank.

She has never had a loan with another bank.  She became familiar with Hlvuku through a friend, who is also a client of the institution.  This is her second loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 15,000 meticals.  She will use it to buy products to increase her quantity of merchandise (rice, oil, beans, peanuts, etc.).  Her previous loan was for 10,000 meticals, and she also put it towards her business.

She promises to make her payments on time.  In the future, she wants to expand her business and diversify her products even more, for which she plans on requesting more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy items to expand her store's inventory (rice, oil, beans, onions, peanuts, etc.).

loans.name: Duo Fe Esperanza Y Amor Group

texts.es: Duo fe esperanza y amor don Jose Antonio se dedica a su trabajo de sastreria el elabora pantalones,  chumpas y trajes para uniformes escolares y los días cuando no tiene mucha pedidos sale a trabajar como ayudante de herrería, gracias a dios a crecido su negocio y ahorra solicita este crédito para poder comprar mas materia prima para su sastreria.ya que nececita mas capital para trabajar espera que kiva les pueda ayudar con el credito  Don Angel Evelio se dedica a la venta de comida.
texts.en: Of the duo Fe, Esperanza y Amor [Faith, Hope and Love] Jose Antonio makes a living with his tailoring work. He makes pants, jackets and school uniform suits. On the days when the work orders are low he works as a blacksmith's aide. Thank God his business has grown and he now requests this loan to be able to purchase more materials for his tailoring. Jose Antonio needs more capital in order to work and he hopes Kiva can help with their loan. Angel Evelio makes a living selling food.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the tailoring of articles of clothing.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is a 44-year-old father of 6 children. He operates a hardware business in Kagadi, which he has operated for 3 years. He started by working as a shop attendant in a hardware shop, saving his small salary so he could start his own business. Leonard wants a loan to buy cement and poles to sell.

Leonard says that the hindering factors towards the growth of his business are customers not paying on time, and price fluctuations. He would like to educate his children, and he wants to move his business to more permanent location.

loans.use: to buy cement and poles to sell.

loans.name: Charles Jussa Esmael

texts.pt:
Nasceu Província de Tete, Centro de Moçambique, casado e pai de 4 filhos todos frequentam a Escola. Fez a 12ª classe e se formou como professor no IMAP e parou os estudos por falta de tempo, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguem. 
		
	
Saiu de Tete para Maputo no Distrito de Boane em missão de serviço. É professor há mais de 17 anos e negociante há mais de 2 anos dono de um salão de cabeleireiro e tem um salário de 11.634.00mt e um rendimento de cerca de 3.000.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BIM).
	
Já teve empréstimos na SOCREMO no valor de 20.000.00mt aplicado na habitação e conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades, conheceu a Hluvuku através de um amigo que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos para o salão e aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria (produtos de cabelo, shampoo, condicionador, óleo, e outros). O empréstimo anterior foi de 6.000.00mt, aplicado no negócio.  
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende ampliar o seu salão para obter mais clientes, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Charles Jussa was born in the province of Tete in the center of Mozambique.  He is married and has four children, all of whom are in school.  He studied through the twelfth grade.  He received a degree in teaching from IMAP [a government teachers' college] and stopped his studies due to lack of time.  He lives in his own home with his family and doesn't support anyone besides them.

He left Tete for Maputo in the district of Boane on an assignment with the military.  He has been a teacher for more than seventeen years and has owned a barber shop for more than two years.  He makes 11,634 meticals as a teacher and 3,000 meticals from his business.  He puts this money towards his home's expenses and also saves some in his bank account at the BIM bank.

He has had loans with the Socremo bank in the amount of 20,000 meticals, which he put towards his home and paid back without any problems.  He became familiar with Hluvuku through a friend, who is also a client of the institution.  This is his second loan with Hluvuku, and it is for 15,000 meticals.  He will use it to buy products for his barber shop and to increase his quantity of merchandise (hair products, shampoo, conditioner, oils, etc.).  His previous loan was for 6,000 meticals, and he put it towards his business.

He promises to make his payments on time.  In the future, he wants to expand his barber shop to obtain more customers, for which he plans on requesting more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy products for his barber shop (hair products, shampoo, conditioner, oils, etc.).

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 40 years old and married with 5 children. She operates a drug shop business dealing in [human] drugs, which she has run for a period of seven years. Margaret got start-up capital for her business by saving her salary when she was employed by the government. The business growth is being affected by inadequate capital, and Margaret wants a loan to buy tablets [medicines] and other requirements to sell.

Margaret dreams of educating her children and buying a car. She also wishes to expand her business to other new markets, and to hire employees to help expand.

loans.use: to buy tablets [medicines] and other requirements to sell.

loans.name: Myasar

texts.en: Myasar sells clothes and she is working from her home. She is looking to open a shop for her business. Myasar is a 43-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan. Myasar is a conservative person. She is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet; thus, the man in the photo is her husband. Myasar is requesting a loan of 500 Jordanian dinars to purchase larger quantities for trading purposes.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for trading purposes

loans.name: Eduardo Macia

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, solteiro e pai de 1 filho que frequenta a Escola. Fez a 12ª classe e parou por falta de tempo, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta a mãe, 4 irmãos e 2 sobrinhos que vivem com ele. 
	

 É professor há mais de 6 anos e tem um salário de 5.500.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BIM).

Nunca teve empréstimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de um amigo que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa (cimento, pedra, areia, ferro, e outros). O empréstimo anterior foi de 10.000.00mt, aplicado na habitação. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a sua casa e mobilar, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Eduardo was born in the district of Boane in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique.  He is single and is the father of one son, who goes to school.  He studied through the twelfth grade and stopped due to lack of time.  He lives in his own home with his family and supports his mother, four siblings, and two nephews, who live with him.

He has been a teacher for more than six years and makes 5,500 meticals, which he puts towards his home's expenses.  He also saves some in his bank account at the BIM bank.

He has never had a loan with another bank.  He became familiar with Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of the institution.  This is his second loan with Hluvuku, and it is for 15,000 meticals.  He will use it to buy construction materials for his home (cement, stone, sand, iron, etc.).  His previous loan was for 10,000 meticals, which he put towards his home.

He promises to make his payments on time.  In the future, he wants to finish his home and furnish it, for which he plans on requesting more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for his home (cement, stone, sand, iron, etc.).

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.fr:
Gabriel est un homme âgé de 30 ans. Il est marié à une revendeuse et a un enfant de 02ans.
Gabriel travaille comme revendeur de produits d’alimentation générale(riz, huile végétale sucre) depuis 2007. Il exerce son activité avec une personne( sa mère). 
Gabriel a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d'alimentation générale. Il veut multiplier les boutiques, devenir grossiste dans l'avenir et assurer un bon avenir à sa famille.
texts.en:
Gabriel is a 30-year old man. His wife is a vendor, and they have a 2-year old child.

Gabriel has been selling staple foods (rice, vegetable oil, sugar) since 2007. He has one more person working in his business (his mother).
Gabriel has requested his first loan from WAGES in order to buy staple foods. He would like to open more stands, and eventually become a wholesaler and ensure future well-being of his family.

loans.use: to buy staple foods.

loans.name: Fernando Francisco Inguane

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 2 filhos que frequentam a Escola. Fez a 5ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta os pais enviando dinheiro para ajudar nas despesas alimentares. 
	

 Trabalha como padeiro há mais de 10 anos e tem um salário de 5.000.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BIM).

Nunca teve empréstimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de um amigo que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa (blocos, cimento, pedra, areia, e outros). Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 10.000.00mt, e 12.000.00mt, aplicados na habitação. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a sua casa, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Fernando Francisco was born in the district of Boane in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique.  He is married and is the father of two children, both of whom are in school.  He studied through the fifth grade and stopped due to his parents' lack of financial resources.  He lives in his own home with his family and also supports his parents by sending them money to help with their food costs.

He has worked as a baker for more than ten years and makes 5,000 meticals, which he puts towards his home's expenses.  He also saves some in his bank account at the BIM bank.

He has never had a loan with another bank.  He became familiar with Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of the institution.  This is his third loan with Hluvuku, and it is for 15,000 meticals.  He will use it to buy construction materials for his home (bricks, cement, stone, sand, etc.).  His previous loans were for 10,000 and 12,000 meticals, which he put towards his home.  He promises to make his payments on time.  In the future, he wants to finish his home, for which he plans on requesting more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for his home (bricks, cement, stone, sand, etc.).

loans.name: Gina Fernando

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Cidade de Maputo, Província de mesmo nome, Sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 3 filhos todos frequentam a Escola. Fez a 4ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 
		
	
É cabeleireira há mais de 5 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 3.000.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BIM).
	
Nunca teve empréstimos noutros, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos de salão para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria (produtos de cabelo, shampoo, condicionador, e outros). O empréstimo anterior foi de 10.000.00mt, aplicado no negócio.  
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende construir o seu próprio salão de beleza, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Gina Fernando was born in the city of Maputo in the province with the same name in southern Mozambique.  She is married and is the mother of three children, all of whom are in school.  She studied through the fourth grade and stopped due to her parents' lack of financial resources.  She lives in her own home with her family and doesn't support anyone besides them.

She has been a hair stylist for more than five years and makes 3,000 meticals, which she puts towards her home's expenses.  She also saves some in her bank account in the BIM bank.

She has never had a loan with another bank.  She became familiar with Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of the institution.  This is her second loan with Hluvuku, and it is for 10,000 meticals.  She will use it to buy products for her salon and to increase her quantity of merchandise (hair products, shampoo, conditioner, etc.).  Her previous loan was for 10,000 meticals, and she put it towards her business.  

She promises to make her payments on time.  In the future, she wants to build her own beauty salon, for which she plans on requesting more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy products for her salon and to increase her quantity of merchandise (hair products, shampoo, conditioner, etc.).

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 41 years old and a businesswoman. She is married to Joseph, a businessman. They are blessed with four children, aged 18, 13, 5, and 2 years old, respectively. She has been selling new clothes for the past five years, with a monthly income of 4,600 Kenyan shillings (KES), which she uses to support her family.

Irene is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced to KADET by a staff member. She will use the loan to buy a stock of new clothes for her business.

She will educate her children with the anticipated profit from the business. Her hopes and dreams are to open a boutique.

loans.use: to buy a stock of new clothes for her business

loans.name: Elisha

texts.en: Elisha is a hardworking, thirty-six-year old man with three children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. His personal goal is to educate himself and buy a car. He is a civil servant who has a business vision of buying land to grow crops and venturing into motorcycle transport. He intends to buy a motorcycle with the loan requested.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Irene José Nunues

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Cidade de Maputo, Província de mesmo nome, Sul de Moçambique, Divorciada e mãe de 7 filhos dos quais 1 frequenta a Escola e os outros já maiores de idade. Fez a 3ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta mais 3 netos que vivem com ela. 
		
	
É negociante há mais de 5 anos dedica-se a venda de produtos alimentares e tem um rendimento de cerca de 6.000.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BIM).
	
Nunca teve empréstimos noutros, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria (óleo, refrescos, farinha, arroz, sumos, e outros). O empréstimo anterior foi de 5.000.00mt, aplicado no negócio.  
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende ampliar o seu negócio e melhorar as condições da sua família, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Irene José was born in the city of Maputo in the province of the same name in southern Mozambique.  She is divorced and is the mother of seven children, one of whom is in school.  The others are already adults.  She studied through the third grade but stopped due to her parents' lack of financial resources.  She lives in her own home with her family and also supports three of her grandchildren that live with her.

She has had a business selling food for more than five years.  She makes almost 6,000 meticals, which she puts towards her home's expenses.  She also saves some in her bank account in the BIM bank.

She has never had a loan with another bank.  She became familiar with Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of the institution.  This is her second loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 10,000 meticals, which she will use to buy products to increase her quantity of merchandise (oil, soft drinks, flour, rice, juice, etc.).  Her previous loan was for 5,000 meticals, which she put towards her business.

She promises to make her payments on time.  In the future, she wants to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions, for which she plans to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to increase her inventory by buying oil, soft drinks, flour, rice, juices, etc.

loans.name: Lisete Venâncio Bila

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 1 filho que frequenta a Escola. Fez a 7ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 
	
	
É negociante há mais de 18 anos dedica-se a venda de produtos diversos tem um rendimento de cerca de 4.000.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BIM).
	
Nunca teve empréstimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria (batata, refrescos, óleo, feijão, amendoim, e outros).  
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende construir uma barraca, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Lisete Venancio was born in the district of Boane in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique.  She is single and is the mother of one son who is in school.  She studied through seventh grade and stopped due to her parents' lack of financial resources.  She lives in her own home with her family and doesn't support anyone besides them.

She has had a business selling various products for more than eighteen years.  She makes almost 4,000 meticals, which she puts towards her home's expenses.  She also saves some in her bank account in the BIM bank.

She has never had a loan with another bank.  She became familiar with Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of the institution.  This is her second loan with Hluvuku, and it is for 15,000 meticals.  She will use it to buy products to increase her quantity of merchandise (potatoes, soft drinks, oil, beans, peanuts, etc.).

She promises to make her payments on time.  In the future, she wants to build a stand, for which she plans on requesting more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy oil, beans, peanuts, soft drinks, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Lodovina Lucas Mangue

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Manjacaze, Província de Gaza, Sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 1 filho que frequenta a Escola. Fez a 7ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta mais 5 sobrinhos que vivem com ela. 
	
	
Saiu de Manjacaze para Maputo no Distrito de Boane a procura de emprego. Trabalha como escritora da cadeia central há mais de 26 anos e também negociante há mais de 7 anos e tem um salário de 4.556.86mt e um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt,, que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BCI).
	
Já teve empréstimos no BCI aplicado na habitação e conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 16.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar cadeiras para revenda. O empréstimo anterior foi de 16.000.00mt, aplicados na habitação. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende fazer crescer o negócio e concluir a sua casa, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Lodovina Lucas was born in the district of Manjacaze in the province of Gaza in southern Mozambique.  She is single and is the mother of one son who is in school.  She studied through the seventh grade but stopped due to her parents' lack of financial resources.  She lives in her own home with her family and also supports five nieces and nephews who live with her.

She left Manjacaze for Maputo in the district of Boane in search of employment.  She has worked as a writer at the central prison for more than 26 years.  She also has had a business for more than seven years.  She makes 4,556.86 meticals at the prison and almost 5,000 at her business.  She puts this money towards her home's expenses and also saves some in her bank account at the BCI bank.

She has had loans with BCI, which she put towards her home and managed to pay back without any problems.  She became familiar with Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of the institution.  This is her second loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 16,000 meticals.  She will use it to buy chairs to resell.  Her previous loan was for 16,000 meticals, and she put it towards her home.

She promises to make her payments on time.  In the future, she wants to grow her business and finish her home, for which she plans on requesting more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy chairs for resale.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema used the previous loan to buy baby items and has applied for another one to buy the same products. Her personal goal is to build a permanent home despite the hardships she faces of seasonal weather and inadequate capital to purchase stock. She has a vision of expanding her business to new markets by setting up different outlets.

loans.use: to buy baby clothes

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en: Leonard is a forty-five-year old man who is married with ten children. He needs the loan requested to buy beers and sodas for resale. His challenges include customers not paying on time and high transport costs. He dreams of building a permanent residential house and hiring more employees to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy sodas and beers for resale

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses used the previous loan to buy salt, sugar and beer for resale. His hardships are price fluctuations, inflation and inadequate capital to purchase stock. He has a vision of his business to include farming and expanding his business to new markets. His personal goal is to educate his children. 

Moses needs the loan to buy salt, sugar and beer for resale.

loans.use: to buy salt, sugar and beer for resale.

loans.name: Habitat Women Group

texts.en: Yolamu is a fifty-year-old married man with five children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. His personal goal is to educate his children and buy a car. He has been in the popcorn business for six years, and his business vision is to move his business to a more permanent location despite the challenges of inadequate capital. He needs the loan requested to buy popcorn for resale.

loans.use: to buy popcorn for resale

loans.name: Phiona

texts.en:
Phiona is a 25-year-old hardworking lady with one child living in Kasese, Uganda. Her personal goals are to educate her child, build a permanent home and buy a car. She has been dealing in clothing sales for five years, after starting with capital of 300,000 Ugandan shillings that has grown to more than 2,000,000 shillings.

Her main hardships are customers not paying on time and inadequate capital to purchase stock; however, she has a goal of expanding her business to new markets. Phiona needs the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is a 44-year-old married man living in Kasese, Uganda. His personal goals are to educate his children, build a permanent home and buy a car. He is a farmer who started on a small scale that has grown large. His major hardships are price fluctuations, inflation and inadequate capital to purchase capital stock; however, he has a vision of buying land to grow crops and moving his business to a more permanent location. Godfrey wants a loan to buy coffee for resale.

loans.use: to buy coffee for resale.

loans.name: Artem Bakunts

texts.en:
