She is requesting a loan worth KES 30,000 in order to purchase oil, chemicals, weaves, hair shampoos and conditioners. The anticipated profit will help her buy two dryers. Her dream is to create job for the youths. This is her first loan.

loans.use: to purchase oil, chemicals,weaves, hair shampoos and conditioners.

loans.name: Elizabeth Mercedes Cobeña Aguilar

texts.es:
En la ciudadela San Cristóbal de la ciudad de Portoviejo conocido como La Ciudad De Los Reales Tamarindos, ciudad bella y hospitalaria, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Damas De Progreso.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Elizabeth, tiene 20 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de tres años de edad, su marido se dedica a la albañilería. Ella estudia los últimos semestres de medicina en la Universidad.

Ella además de atender su hogar y sus estudios también se dedica al comercio,  vende productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, perfumería y accesorios de damas), trabaja todos los días y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, también les vende a  sus compañeras en su Universidad. Deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días, se inicio en este negocio hace más de tres  años y le ha ido muy bien ya que cuenta con muy buena clientela.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, bisutería y cosméticos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace más de tres  años y le gusta por la ayuda y beneficios que recibe de la institución.

Sus metas son terminar su carrera y tener su casa propia pues vive en casa de los padres.
texts.en:
In the San Cristobal neighborhood of the city of Portoviejo, a beautiful and welcoming place known as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the communal bank "Damas de Progreso" meets every 15 days.

Here we meet Elizabeth, 20, who is in a common-law marriage and has a 3 year-old child.  Her husband works in construction.  She is in her last semesters of studying medicine at the university.

In addition to tending to her home and her studies, Elizabeth has a business selling Yanbal products (beauty products, perfumes and women's accessories).  She works every day, and she sells her products door-to-door, and she also sells to her fellow students at the university.  She sells on credit and collects every 15 days.  She started this business more than 3 years ago, and it has gone very well because she has a very good customer base. 

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, creams, accessories and cosmetics.  Elizabeth has been with her communal bank for more than 3 years, and she likes it because of the help and benefits she receives from the institution.

Her goals are to finish her degree and have her own home, as she now lives in her parent's home.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, accessories and cosmetics

loans.name: Dukore Twitezimbere Group

texts.fr:
Madame Félicité, agricultrice des pommes de terre fait partie du groupe DUKORE TWITEZIMBERE (qui veut dire travaillons pour notre développement). ELle a 45 ans, mariée et a 7 enfants dont le plus âgé a 21 ans et le moins âgé a 5 ans. Six de ses enfants vont à l'école et aucune autre personne n'est en sa charge. Son niveau d'éducation est 8 ans de l'école primaire.
Elle est devenue cliente d'ACB en 2010 et le cycle actuel est le 2ème pour elle. Elle a bien remboursé le crédit antérieur. Le crédit actuel lui a permit d'acheter 200 kgs des pommes de terre, 1 sac d'angrais chimiques, etc. Trop de soleil ou trop de pluie sont les seuls éléments qui peuvent faire que ce crédit soit remboursé difficilement.Pour accroître son activité agricole, Madame Felicité a une stratégie d'augmenter la surface qu'elle cultive en achetant d'autres champs. Ceci sera possible grâce aux crédits qu'elle va solliciter dans le futur. Elle a l'ambition, après avoir augmenté la surface, de diversifier les produits qu'elle cultive. Pour la famille, elle va continuer d'éduquer ses enfants et va construire une maison residentielle pour sa famille. A part de l'activité financée, Madame Félicité fait l'élévage des chèvres.
texts.en:
Félicité is a potato farmer and a member of the DUKORE TWITEZIMBERE group (which means "let's work for our development").  She is 45 years old, married, and has seven children, whose ages range between 21 and 5 years.  Six of her children are in school, and she has no other dependent.  Her education level is 8 years of elementary education.

Félicité became a client of ACB in 2010, and she is on to her second loan cycle.  Her previous loan was well repaid.  With this loan, she is buying 200 kilos of potatoes and one bag of chemical fertilizer.  The only two elements that could make repayment of the loan difficult are either too much sun or too much rain.  To increase her farming activity, Félicité's strategy is to increase her surface of cultivated land through the purchase of additional fields.  This will become a possibility in the future thanks to the loans that she will be requesting.  After increasing her surface of arable land, her next ambition is to diversify her crops.

Regarding her family, Félicité will continue to educate her children and she will be building a residential house for her family.  Besides the activity for which she receives financing, Félicité also raises goats.

loans.use: to buy 200 kilos of potatoes, 1 bag of chemical fertilizer, 25 kilos of Dithane etc..

loans.name: Sandra Paola Bustamante Montes

texts.es:
En la ciudadela San Cristóbal de la ciudad de Portoviejo conocido como La Ciudad De Los Reales Tamarindos, ciudad bella y hospitalaria, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Damas De Progreso.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Sandra, tiene 27 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 8 y 4 años de edad, el mayor estudia en escuela y el menor este año  entra al jardín de infantes. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella  para ganar algo por su cuenta se dedica al igual que su esposo al comercio, ellos venden ropa de todo tipo, zapatos, carteras y varios productos más,  su esposo y ella trabajan por separado mientras que el se va a otros cantones ella vende por su localidad, ventas que realiza puerta a puerta, ella trabaja de tres a cuatro días por semana ya que también tiene que atender a sus pequeños hijos, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace mas de 10 años, años en los que le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene bastante clientela.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar más mercadería como ropa, carteras, zapatos, bisuterías, entre otras cosas. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace  tres años y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y sin tantos requisitos.
 
Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
The city of Portoviejo is known as the city of the Royal Tamarind Trees, a beautiful and friendly city. The communal bank “Damas de Progreso” meet here twice a month in the citadel San Cristóbal.

This is where we meet Sandra, who is 27 years old, married with 2 children who are 8 and 4 years old. The oldest is a student, and the youngest will enter kindergarten this year. Her husband is a businessman.

In order to earn something on her own she shares equally the workload with her husband in the business. They sell all types of clothing, shoes, handbags and various other products. They work separately while visiting other cantons. She sells in her own neighborhood, going from door to door. She works three or four days a week and also cares for her little children. She allows her customers credit, and collects weekly payments. She has been doing this activity for more than 10 years, years in which she has done very well since she has enough customers.

She is going to use the money from this loan to buy more merchandise such as clothing, handbags, shoes, jewelry and other items. She has been a member of the communal bank for three years and she likes it because the loans are granted quickly without too many requirements.

Her dream is to give all she can to provide for her children.

loans.use: to buy clothes, handbags, shoes, jewelry, and other items

loans.name: Dukundumurimo Group

texts.fr:
Madame Lydie fait partie du groupe DUKUNDUMURIMO. Le nom du groupe veut dire aimons le travail. Lydie est agricultrice des pommes de terre, mariée et a 46 ans. Elle a 4 enfants dont le plus âgé a 19 ans et le moins âgé a 7 ans. Tous ses enfants vont à l'école. Elle a une autre personne en sa charge.Son niveau d'éducation est 8 ans de l'école primaire.
Elle a débuté de travailler avec ACB en 2011 et est au deuxième cycle de crédit. Le crédit lui accordé lui a permit d'acheter 1000 kgs des pommes de terres pour la semance, 500 kgs d'angrais chimiques et une pompte qui sera utilisé pour mettre les angrais chimiques dans les pommes de terres. Le soleil ou autre evenement improvisé comme l'innondation ou autres intempéries peuvent être les seules qui peuvent faire que le crédit soit remboursé difficilement. Pour l'avenir, elle a une stratégie de solliciter d'autres prêts en vue d'augmenter la capacité de son agriculture. Pour se faire, elle va acheter d'autres champs et la production va se multiprier. Avec cette stratégie, elle a l'ambition de devenir une grandre agricultrice dans le secteur d'agriculture des pommes de terre. Elle va continuer de payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants et va constuire une maison d'habitation pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Lydie is part of the group DUKUNDUMURIMO. The group's name means "We love work". Lydie is a potato farmer, 46 years old, and married. She has four children, of whom the oldest is 19, and the youngest is 7. All of the children go to school. She has another person to support and has a 8th grade education.

Lydie started working with the microfinance institution ACB in 2011 and is now on her second loan cycle. The loan granted enabled her to buy 1,000 kg of seed potatoes, 500 kg of fertilizers, and a pump for applying the fertilizer to the potatoes. What can cause problems in repaying the loan might be the sun or unplanned events, such as flooding or other bad weather. 

For the future, Lydie has a strategy to request more loans with the goal of increasing her farm's capacity. To do so, she is going to buy more fields, and production will multiple. 

With this strategy, she has the ambition of becoming a major farmer in the potato sector. She is going to continue paying her children's school costs and to build a house in which her family will live.

loans.use: To buy 1,000 kg of potatoes, 500 kg of fertilizer, 1 pump, etc.

loans.name: Ana Liliana Gudiel

texts.es:
La Señora Ana, tiene 50 años de edad, vive con su compañero de hogar y tiene 1 hijo, Su actividad principal es la abarroteria (pulpería)  desde hace más de 10 años, cuenta con  con el apoyo de su pareja en el manejo de su negocio, Doña Ana esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de productos como ser: azúcar, manteca, jabón, refrescos, carnes, papel higiénico, maíz, frijoles y otros productos de consumo, para la buena atención de sus clientes, ya que al tener su negocio ubicado en un punto estratégico frente a una escuela técnica, con el apoyo solicitado del préstamo que reciba Doña Ana, le contribuirá a tener un mejor negocio y así obtener mejores ingresos para cubrir los gastos en el hogar, y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y salir adelante.
Doña Ana uno de sus sueños es tener una de los mejores pulperías de la zona.

Danlí El Paraíso, Honduras - Marzo 2012
texts.en:
Ana is 50, lives with her partner and has one son. Her main livelihood for more than ten years has been her grocery store. She has her partner's help in running the business. 

Ana is applying for the loan to buy products such as sugar, lard, soap, soft drinks, meats, toilet paper, corn, beans, and other household products, in order to give her customers good service. 

As her business is located at a strategic point in front of a technical school, the support of the loan she is getting will be instrumental in her having a better business. In this way she will earn better income to cover the household expenses, give her family a better quality of life, and get ahead in life.

One of Ana's dreams is to have one of the best grocery stores in the area.

loans.use: To buy sugar, lard, soap, soft drinks, meats, toilet paper, corn, beans, and other household products for her business.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гулнора трудолюбивая и добросовестная женщина. Она разведена и на воспитании имеет одного ребенка. Она  старается содержать своего ребенка в достатке, и создать все условия в семье. Более 3-х лет Гулнора занимается купле- продажей продуктов питания. У неё в магазине широкий ассортимент продуктов и много постоянных клиентов. Она всегда привозит свежие продукты на продажу. Она также занимается купле- продажей женских тканей в своем  магазине. В бизнесе помогает ей её брат. Гулнора хотела бы получить займ для покупки продуктов питания и новых тканей с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Gulnora is a hardworking and honest woman. She is divorced and is raising one child. She tries to provide to fulfill the needs of her child and create good conditions for her family. Gulnora has been buying and selling food for more than three years. Her store has a wide range of products and a lot of regular customers. She always brings in fresh products for sale. She also buys and sells women's fabrics in her store. Her brother helps her in this business. Gulnora wants to take out a loan to buy food products and new fabrics with the goal to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy foods and fabrics.

loans.name: Johanna Margarita

texts.es:
En la ciudadela San Cristóbal de la ciudad de Portoviejo conocido como La Ciudad De Los Reales Tamarindos, ciudad bella y hospitalaria, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Damas De Progreso.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Johanna, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 14, 12, 10 y 2 años de edad, los dos  mayores estudian en colegio y el siguiente en escuela. Su esposo es mecánico de bicicletas.

Ella como buena esposa y para ayudar a su esposo realiza el crédito para que él lo utilice en su trabajo, su esposo tiene un taller de bicicletas allí realiza todo tipo de arreglos ya que este es un medio de transporte muy utilizado en la ciudad, además tiene un pequeño local en el cual  vende repuestos para bicicletas los mismos que él se encarga de utilizar para los arreglos si sus clientes así lo desean. Ella también y para ayudar con los gastos del hogar trabaja en las mañanas en una panadería del lugar en la cual se gana algo extra. Su marido lleva más de 18 años en su taller y  casi nunca le falta trabajo.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar llantas, tubos, parches, y muchos otros artículos para las bicicletas. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta por la ayuda ya que con los créditos con los cuales ha mejorado el negocio y su situación económica.

Su sueño es tener su propia panadería.
texts.en:
The city of Portoviejo is known as the city of the Royal Tamarind Trees, a beautiful and friendly city. The communal bank “Damas de Progreso” meet here twice a month in the citadel of San Cristóbal.

Here we meet Johanna who is 31 years old, married with 4 children who are 14, 12, 10, and 2 years of age. The two oldest children are in middle school, and the next oldest is in primary. Her husband is a bicycle mechanic. As a good wife she helps her husband and is asking for a loan to use in his work. Her husband has a bicycle shop and there he makes all types of repairs as this method of transportation is used a lot in the city. Furthermore, he has a little business selling parts for bicycles that his clients can use for repairs if they wish to do it themselves.

She also helps with the household expenses working in the morning in a neighborhood bakery in order to earn a bit extra. Her husband has had his workshop for 18 years and is almost never short of work.

The money from this loan will be used to buy tires, tubes, patches, and other supplies for bicycles. She has been in the communal bank since it began and she likes it because of the help the loans provides which has improved the business and her economic situation.

Her dream is to have her own bakery.

loans.use: to buy tires, tubes, patches and other bicycle supplies

loans.name: Maritza Andrea

texts.es:
Maritza se ha dedicado gran parte de su vida a trabajar con el ánimo de poder ofrecer en su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Proveniente de una familia con escasos recursos económicos, decidió iniciar su propio negocio para generar ingresos con los cuales pueda sostener en parte los gastos del hogar donde convivía con sus padres. Posteriormente, Maritza se casó y ahora tiene 2 hijos de 3 y 5 años de edad con los que ha podido progresar en su vida y a quienes siempre les ha querido brindar, al igual que a sus padres, una buena calidad de vida. Maritza tiene un negocio de venta de productos de uso personal a través de catálogos donde ofrece principalmente cosméticos y gracias a esto genera ingresos con los cuales contribuye al sostenimiento de su hogar. En su negocio, siempre se ha caracterizado por ofrecer una muy buena atención y esto le ha permitido captar un gran número de clientes, los cuales a su vez le hacen una gran cantidad de pedidos. Con el ánimo de responder a un gran pedido que le ha hecho un cliente suyo, Maritza busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de productos de uso personal para poder atender el pedido de uno de sus clientes y seguir progresando con su negocio.

Maritza espera que de esta manera su negocio le siga generando los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento del hogar, y seguir contribuyendo a que sus hijos y su esposo tengan una mejor calidad de vida. Maritza sueña con tener un gran negocio en el cual pueda ofrecer empleo para los más necesitados y desde el cual le pueda brindar a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Maritza has dedicated a great part of her life to working, with the desire to offer her family a better quality of life. Coming from a family with scarce economic resources, she decided to start her own business to generate income with which she can cover part of the expenses of her household, where she lived together with her parents. Later, Maritza got married, and now she has 2 children, aged 3 and 5, with whom she has been able to make progress in life, and for whom she has always wanted to provide, as for her parents, a good quality of life. Maritza has a business selling products for personal use through catalogs, where she principally offers cosmetics. Thanks to this, she generates income with which she contributes to sustaining her household. In her business, she has always been known to offer very good service, and this has permitted her to attract a large number of customers, who in turn place a great quantity of orders. With the desire to fulfill a large order that one of her customers has made, Maritza is seeking a loan which will give her the opportunity to buy personal products to fulfill the order of one of her customers and keep making progress with her business. 

Maritza hopes that in this way, her business will keep generating the necessary income to sustain her household, and keep contributing to provide her children and her husband a better quality of life. Maritza dreams to have a large business in which she can offer employment to people who need it most, and which will help her provide her family with better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy personal products to fulfill an order from one of her customers and continue making progress with her business.

loans.name: Clémence Mylène

texts.fr: Clémence Mylène est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle est spécialisée dans la vente de céréales et de divers. Son fonds de commerce est située en pleine ville de Cotonou. En vue d'accroître son pouvoir d'achat et de maximiser son bénéfice, elle sollicite à Finadev un micro crédit afin d'honorer ses engagements vis-à-vis de ses clients et de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Clémence Mylène is married and a mother of three. She specializes in cereal and grocery retail. Her business is located right in downtown Cotonou.
To increase her purchasing power and maximize her profits, she is requesting a micro-loan from Finadev. It will allow her to meet her obligations to her customers and children.

loans.use: to buy two bags of corn, two bags of gari (cassava flour) and thirty miscellaneous articles.

loans.name: Sandra Giraldo

texts.es:
Sin un gran capital para montar un negocio que le genere buenos ingresos para sostener los gastos de su hogar, Sandra se ha rebuscado la manera de iniciar su propio negocio de arreglo de uñas con el cual ha generado ingresos con los cuales contribuye para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar, donde convive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Debido a que el salario de su esposo es muy bajo y no alcanza para cubrir todos los gastos que se generan, Sandra decidió montar su negocio y con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado posicionarlo en sus clientes principalmente por la buena atención que ofrece. Gracias a que últimamente su negocio ha venido creciendo en buenas proporciones, Sandra ha empezado a requerir una mayor cantidad de utensilios y que estos sean de mejor calidad, es por esto que busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de productos como esmaltes, limas y demás insumos que requiere para su negocio de arreglo de uñas.

Sandra espera que de esta manera su negocio siga creciendo y pueda seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes una buena atención y un buen servicio. Además, Sandra sueña con sacar sus hijos adelante y poderles brindar una buena educación y mayores oportunidades económicas en su vida.
texts.en:
Without a lot of capital to start a business that generates good income to pay for her home's expenses, Sandra has looked for a way to start her own manicure business.  She has made income with this, which contributes to paying for her home's expenses.  She lives with her husband and two children.  Since her husband's wages are very low, they didn't cover all of their expenss.  Sandra decided to start her own business, and with a lot of effort, she positioned it so her customers come to her for the good service that she offers.  Thanks to the fact that her business has recently grown, Sandra has started to require a larger quantity of tools and that they be of a better quality.  This is why she is looking for a loan that will offer her the possibility of buying products like nail polish, nail files, and other supplies that her manicure business needs.

Sandra hopes that in this way, her business will keep growing and she can continue offering her customers good attention and service.  Sandra also hopes to help her children get ahead and offer them a good education and better economic opportunities in their lives.

loans.use: to buy products like nail polish, nail files, and other supplies that her manicure business needs.

loans.name: Luis Argemiro Arias

texts.es:
Argemiro es una persona que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajador y siempre querer ofrecer en su hogar una mejor calidad de vida. Es por esto que desde hace aproximadamente 20 años viene trabajando fuertemente en su negocio el cual es una cafetería ubicada en el parque principal de su municipio y donde ofrece a sus clientes café, bebidas alcohólicas y snack. Con los ingresos que le brinda este negocio, Argemiro ha tenido la oportunidad de ofrecer en su hogar una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas, por lo que su familia ha progresado mucho desde entonces. Con el ánimo de surtir su negocio, Argemiro busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de productos como gaseosas, café, snack, entre otros y poder seguir ofreciendo buenos productos a sus clientes.

Argemiro espera que de esta manera su negocio siga saliendo adelante y siga ofreciendo en su hogar mejores oportunidades económicas.
texts.en:
Argemiro is a person who has always been known for being very hard-working, and he always wants to offer a better quality of life in his household. For this reason, for approximately the past 20 years, he has been working hard in his business, which is a café located in the main park of his municipality, where he offers his customers coffee, alcoholic drinks and snacks. With the income this business provides, Argemiro has had the opportunity to provide a better quality of life in his household and better economic opportunities, and because of this his family has made great progress since then. With the desire to stock his business, Argemiro is seeking a loan to provide the opportunity to buy products such as soft drinks, coffee, snacks and other items, so he can keep offering good products to his customers. 

Argemiro hopes that in this way, his business will keep moving forward, and it will keep offering better economic opportunities to his household.

loans.use: to buy products such as soft drinks, coffee, snacks, and others, so that he can keep offering good products to his customers.

loans.name: Martha Isabel Sanchez

texts.es:
Martha es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de un hijo de 14 años, a quien siempre le ha querido brindar una buena educación y una buena calidad de vida. Es por esto que siempre se ha esforzado en su trabajo para poder generar ingresos que le permitan progresar a ella y a su hijo y de esta manera pueda brindarle mejores condiciones de vida que a las que ella podía acceder. Martha tiene un empleo que ha conservado durante mucho tiempo gracias al salario que le pagan, y además de esto ha montado una venta de ropa donde ofrece prendas de vestir para dama y con lo cual genera ingresos extras para poder sostener todos los gastos que incurre en su hogar. En su negocio de venta de ropa se ha caracterizado por la buena atención que ofrece a sus clientes, y esto le ha permitido tener una gran clientela que le garantiza muy buenas ventas. Debido a que poco a poco ha ido creciendo su negocio, Martha busca un préstamo que le permita acceder a la compra de prendas de vestir para ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes y así aumentar sus ventas.

Martha espera que de esta manera su negocio se capitalice cada vez más y sus ingresos aumenten para ofrecer en su hogar una mejor calidad de vida. Además, Martha espera que con mayores ingresos su hijo pueda gozar de una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas.
texts.en:
Martha is a single mother who is head of her family with a 14 year old son, who always has wanted to provide him a good education and a good quality of life. This is why she has always been determined to work in order to earn money in order for her and her son to get ahead and in this way she could give him the best conditions in life that she was able to.

Martha has employment that has provided for them for a long time on the wages that they pay her, and besides this she has begun her own business of selling clothing where she offers clothing for ladies and with which she earns extra income in order to be able to support all the household expenses.

In her business of selling clothing, she has been known for the good customer service she offers her clients and this has permitted her to have a large clientele that guarantees good sales, and because of this her business has grown little by little.

Martha is asking for a loan in order to buy clothing so she can offer a better variety to her customers and thus increase her sales.

Martha hopes that in this way her business will continually capitalize itself and her earnings increase in order to offer her household a better quality of life. Also, Martha hopes that with more income her son can enjoy a better quality of life and have better economic opportunities.

loans.use: to buy clothing in order to offer a greater variety to her customers and thus increase her sales.

loans.name: Carmen Julia Florez

texts.es:
Desde hace aproximadamente 33 años, Carmen trabaja ofreciendo comida a los comerciantes de la plaza mayorista de la ciudad y con este trabajo genera los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Con 4 hijos a su cargo, Carmen siempre ha tenido la necesidad de generar los ingresos con los cuales les pueda ofrecer una buena calidad de vida, y es por esto que siempre se ha esforzado enormemente en su trabajo para contribuir económicamente en su progreso. Carmen se ha hecho conocer en su negocio gracias al buen servicio que ofrece a sus clientes y a la buena calidad y el buen sabor de las comidas que ofrece, y esto le ha permitido crecer poco a poco y cada vez tener más clientes en su negocio. Con el ánimo de seguir progresando en su negocio, Carmen busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de una fritadora más grande, ollas para preparar sus comidas y seguir así ofreciendo un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Carmen espera que de esta manera su negocio siga saliendo adelante y pueda seguir ofreciendo una buena calidad en sus comidas. Además, Carmen sueña que su negocio se pueda ubicar en un local fijo y así pueda ser más atractivo el negocio para sus clientes.
texts.en:
For approximately 33 years, Carmen has worked offering food to the merchants in the wholesale market plaza of the city, and with this work she generates the necessary income to sustain her household. With 4 children in her care, Carmen has always had the need to generate the income with which she can offer them a better quality of life. For this reason, she has always put forth great effort in her work to contribute economically to their progress. Carmen has become well-known with her business thanks to the good service she offers her customers and the good quality and good flavor of the foods she offers. This has allowed her to grow little by little, and gradually have more customers in her business. With the desire to continue progressing in her business, Carmen is seeking a loan to give her the opportunity to buy a larger fryer and pots to prepare her foods, so that she can continue offering better service to her customers. 

Carmen hopes that in this way, her business will keep moving forward, and she can keep offering good quality in her foods, In addition, Carmen dreams of moving her business to a permanent building, so that she can make it more attractive to her customers.

loans.use: to buy a larger fryer and pots to prepare her food, in order to offer better service to her customers.

loans.name: Riziki Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kikuru, membre du groupe de crédit  Riziki, Femme  dynamique, entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 60 ans. Elle est  vendeuse de farine de manioc. Son mari est un fonctionnaire dans l’administration publique. Elle a commencé son business de lors qu’elle fut mariée. Il ya 3 ans qu’elle  fut informée de micro crédit qu’octroi l’IMF Hekima. Ainsi, elle bénéficia son premier crédit de 50$ pour renforcer  ses affaires. Les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation et d’appui à la scolarité de ses  enfants. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  12eme  crédit. Au cours de la période, cette cliente a vu ses affaires prospèrent positivement. Ainsi elle a  décidé d’augmenter son montant de crédit pour ce nouveau cycle. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  150 kg de farine de manioc.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir et reconstruire sa maison car elle a été victime d’un incendie, qui consuma sa maison et tous ses biens. La cliente remercie Hekima pour  les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
Customer Kikuru is a member of the loan group Riziki. She is an energetic woman and an experienced entrepreneur aged sixty. She retails cassava flour. Her husband is a civil servant working for the government.
She started her business when she got married. Three years ago, she was informed of micro-loans granted by IMF Hekima. She thus benefited from her first $50 loan, which she used to strengthen her business. She allocates profits from her business to savings, food, and to contribute to her children's school fees.
She was just granted her 12th loan; however, in this period, this customer has seen her business prosper. She therefore decided to increase the loan amount for this new cycle. This latest loan will be used to procure 150 kilos of cassava flour. Additionally, she wishes to see her children grow up and to rebuild her house, as she was recently stricken by a fire which consumed her house and all her belongings.
The customer thanks Hekima for it actions fostering self-sufficiency for poor women excluded from traditional banking.

loans.use: to pay for 150 kilos cassava flour.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Ayaba Jeanne

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de quatre enfants, Ayaba Jeanne est une tisserante de formation. Elle associe à son activité la vente de pagnes, bazins et fait aussi de la restauration devant son domicile. Dans le but de satisfaire les besoins de ses clients, elle sollicite et obtient un concours à Finadev afin de renforcer son activité et de participer aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Married and a mother of four, Ayaba Jeanne is a weaver by training. She complements her business with the sale of "pagnes” and pieces of brocade; she also sells prepared food from the front of her house.
In order to meet customer demand, she is requesting and being granted a loan from Finadev. The loan will allow her to strengthen her business and to participate to the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy twenty "pagnes" (local cloth), ten pieces of brocade and two spools of thread .

loans.name: Arche Group

texts.fr: La cliente Wayali, membre du groupe de crédit  arche, femme vivant seule, dynamique, ambitieuse, entrepreneur autodidacte, âgée de 51 ans. Elle est  vendeuses des boissons (Primus, Fanta, Mutzig, etc.). Elle a commencé son business par la vente de cannes à sucre au long de la rue, plus tard elle évolua et changea l’activité. Elle détient une petite maisonnette dénommée place vadam, siège où elle reçoit ses clients qui viennent attiser leur soif. Alors qu’elle  fut informée de micro crédit qu’octroi l’IMF Hekima, elle bénéficia son premier crédit de 50$ pour renforcer  ses affaires. Les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation et d’appui à la scolarité de ses  enfants et petits fils. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  7eme  crédit. Au cours de la période, cette cliente a vu ses affaires prospèrent positivement. Ainsi elle a  décidé d’augmenter son montant de crédit pour ce nouveau cycle. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  30 casiers (de Fanta, Primus, Mutzig, etc.).  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir et ouvrir ses horizons en ouvrant un snack bar.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
This client, Wayali, is 51 years old and a member of the loan group Arche. She lives alone and is an energetic, ambitious, and self-taught entrepreneur. She sells beverages (Primus, Fanta, Mutzig, etc.). She started her business by selling sugar cane at the roadside. Later, her business changed and evolved. She has a small hut called Place Vadam, where she welcomes her customers who come to [quench] their thirst. 

She was informed of the microloans awarded by the MFI Hekima, and she benefited from her first loan of $50 for bolstering her business. The profits from her work go toward savings, food, and schooling support for her children and grandchildren. 

Meanwhile, she has just obtained her seventh loan. During the time period, this client saw her business prosper. So she decided to increase her loan amount for this new cycle. This new loan must serve to supply her with 30 cases (de Fanta, Primus, Mutzig, etc.). In addition, she wishes to see her children grow up and to expand her horizons by opening a snack bar. 

This client thanks Hekima for the actions it takes to help poor women excluded from traditional banks to become autonomous.

loans.use: to pay for 30 cases (of Fanta, Fanta, Primus, Mutzig, etc.)

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Claudia Cecilia Hurtado

texts.es:
Claudia es una persona que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora y siempre querer ofrecer una buena calidad de vida a su esposo y su hijo de 6 años. Debido a que los ingresos que generaba su esposo no eran suficientes para sostener todos los gastos de su hogar, Claudia decidió montar sin mucho capital un negocio de confección de prendas de vestir, con el cual ha podido aportar económicamente con los ingresos de su hogar. Gracias a este negocio, su familia ha podido gozar de una mejor calidad de vida y su hijo ha podido tener acceso a una educación de mejor calidad. Las principales ventajas que presenta Claudia es la buena atención que ofrece a sus clientes y la buena calidad de sus productos; sin embargo, su principal dificultad es la falta de capital para poder trabajar su negocio con mejores condiciones, y es por esto que Claudia busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de insumos y materiales para su negocio y a realizar el mantenimiento de una de sus máquinas de confección.

Claudia espera que de esta manera su negocio siga saliendo adelante y siga ofreciendo a sus clientes mejor calidad en sus productos. Además, Claudia espera que con mejores ventas, su trabajo le brinde la posibilidad de cumplir su sueño de tener una casa propia donde pueda convivir mejor con su esposo y su hijo.
texts.en:
Claudia is a person who has always been known for being very hard-working, and always wanting to offer a good quality of life to her husband and her 6-year-old son. Because the income generated by her husband were not sufficient to cover all of their household's expenses, Claudia decided to start a business, without much capital, making clothing. With this business, she has been able to contribute economically to her household income. Thanks to this business, her family has been able to enjoy a better quality of life, and her son has been able to gain access to a higher quality education. The main advantages presented by Claudia are the good service she offers her customers and the good quality of her products; however, her main difficulty is the lack of capital to allow her to work in her business with better conditions. For this reason, she is seeking a loan to provide the opportunity to buy supplies and materials for her business, and to perform maintenance on one of her sewing machines. 

Claudia hopes that in this way her business will keep moving forward, and she can keep offering her customers good quality in her products. In addition, Claudia hopes that with better sales, her work can offer her the opportunity to fulfill her dream to have a house of her own, where she can live better together with her husband and her son.

loans.use: to buy supplies and materials for her business and perform maintenance on one of her sewing machines.

loans.name: Betty Kiden

texts.en:
Betty lives in Yei. She sells from a food stall, and has been in business for two years. She is 30 years old, married, and has three children. All of them are still in school. 

Betty heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase beans and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and onions for sale

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 32 years old, from Olkalou, and is married with three children who are in school.

Alice is a farmer and has been in it for the past two years. She has applied for her fourth loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy a dairy cow. 

She hopes to have many dairy cows in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en: Chantal is 33 years old and is married with two children between the ages of 7 and 9 years old. Her business is well organized - she sells various goods, such as rice, sugar, soap, salt, and cooking oil from 8 a.m. until 9 p.m. every day. She currently employs one person to help her. Chantal has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by buying more quantities of sugar, rice, breads, soap, salt, and so on to sell. She plans to use any profits generated from this loan to satisfy her family's basic needs and to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, rice, breads, soap, and salt to sell

loans.name: Menelio

texts.en:
Menelio has worked in public administration at a university for 30 years. He is 58 years old and separated, with two children ages 22 and 23. Menelio is requesting a loan to pay for his children’s university education. Menelio dreams of seeing his children complete their degrees in law and industrial engineering.

Menelio is a member of the village bank, "Los Hijos de Qolquewasi", in Cusco. He is receiving his 18th loan from Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Gina Patricia

texts.en:
Gina Patricia has been selling beauty products for about five years. She specializes in catalog sales, visiting friends and offices every time a new catalog arrives. She is 34 years old and has two daughters, who are 9 and 12 years old. Gina would like a loan in order to buy beauty products, such as perfumes, jewelry, and cosmetics for delivery to her customers. Gina’s dreams are to have her own shop where she can sell beauty products, and also for her children to complete a university education.

Gina is a member of the village bank, "Los Hijos de Qolquewasi", in Cusco, which is receiving its 18th loan from Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products

loans.name: Marisol

texts.en:
Marisol is 34 years old and sells Italian lingerie to her friends and other mothers at the school her nine-year-old daughter attends. She does not use a catalog; rather she visits her customers and brings her wares with her. Marisol has been running this business for about three years, with help from a friend who sends her products from Italy. Marisol is requesting a loan in order to purchase more lingerie. Her dream is to open a proper store, and to pay for her daughter’s education.

Marisol is a member of the village bank, "Los Hijos de Qolquewasi", in Cusco, which is receiving its 18th loan from Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy Italian lingerie for her business

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris has been working with Asociación Arariwa for 14 years. She is 52 years old and single with one daughter, who is 15 years old. Doris has a store where she sells children’s clothes - mostly hand-knit pieces but also some manufactured dresses. She purchases the knits from women at the local market, as well as from other members of Arariwa’s village banks. Doris is requesting a loan in order to purchase more children’s clothing in time for Mother’s Day, which is celebrated on the second Sunday of May in Peru. In the future, she would like to invest in internet training so that she can start selling clothes online.

Doris is a member of the village bank, "Los Hijos de Qolquewasi", in Cusco, which is receiving its 18th loan from Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing

loans.name: Soem

texts.en:
Soem is 24 years old and is a mother of two young kids. They all live in Ornlong Veng district of Siem Reap province. She cultivates rice for her livelihood and distributes it to support the family. Her husband is the main income provider of the family. He works at the construction field and he specializes in constructing wooden houses. 

Soem would like to open a CDs shop from her house, as she realizes that it’ll be profitable and there aren’t many competitors in her operational area. However, she needs some sufficient capital to set up this new business. Now she is asking for a loan from HKL to prepare a new shop and to buy stock of CDs for her first inventory. With the increase in income, Soem wants to save it for her business expansion in the future.

loans.use: to prepare a new shop and buy stock of CDs for her first inventory

loans.name: Yan

texts.en:
Yan is a married woman. She lives with her spouse in Ornlong Veng district. Her preferred business is crops husbandry. It’s the only business from which she can earn a suitable household income against her daily expenses. Yan grows rice and potatoes on a few hectares of inherited farmland passed down by her ancestors. She enjoys doing her daily performances along with her spouse, who gets involved in the same type of business. 

Yan needs this loan to pay for a plowing fee and to pay for the land preparation. After that, she will start growing potatoes for this season. In the coming years, Yan wants to buy a plowing machine that will enable her to continue progressing with her business and make a good harvest.

loans.use: to pay for a plowing fee and land preparation

loans.name: Agnes Wanjiru  Njuguna

texts.en: Agnes is 27 years old and married with one child. She sells plastic basins and sandals to earn a living. She has been in the business for three years and has employed one person. She describes her business environment as busy because she is visited regularly by her customers. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her business and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 100,000 Kenya Shillings to buy plastic basins and sandals for selling.

loans.use: to buy plastic basins and sandals for selling

loans.name: Violet Khasiro Hezron

texts.en:
Violet is 46 years old. She is married with four children. She sells clothes to earn a living. She has been in the business for 21 years and has employed two people. She also does tailoring to earn extra income. She describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to educate her children and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for a 50,000 Kenya Shillings loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Micheline Arlette

texts.fr: Coiffeuse de formation, Micheline Arlette vit avec son mari et ses trois enfants. Elle vend des mèches, des produits cosmétiques et s'approvisionne sur les marchés environnants. Expérimentée dans le crédit, elle sollicite et obtient à Finadev un micro-crédit en vue de renforcer son pouvoir d'achat et de maximiser son profit pour le bien-être de la famille.
texts.en:
A hairdresser by training, Micheline Arlette lives with her husband and her three children. She sells hair extensions and beauty products which she procures from nearby markets.
Experienced with loans, she requested a micro-loan from Finadev, which she was granted in order to increase her purchasing power and to maximize her profits for the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy thirty hair extensions and fifty beauty products.

loans.name: Elisabeth Group

texts.fr:
Mme IRENE  est la représentante du groupe ELISABETH. Elle est mariée  et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 25ans et le moins âgé a 21ans. Les 03  vont à l’école. Elle a 07 personnes en charge.

Elle vend des habits et des pagnes  depuis  06ans. Elle s’approvisionne  au grand  marché et au marché du secteur 10 en ville .Ses clients sont  les  femmes et hommes.

Elle veut  s’acheter  05 pièces de pagnes et des habits.

Elle utilise  ses bénéfices pour aider son mari dans la scolarisation des enfants. Elle ambitionne voir son activité se developper, voyager dans les pays voisins pour s’approvisionner et voir ses enfants réussir  dans l’avenir.
texts.en:
Mrs. Irene is the leader of group Elisabeth. She is married and a mother of four. The oldest is 25 and the youngest 21 years old. All three attend school. She has seven people in her care.
She has been retailing clothing and ‘pagnes’ for six years. She gets her supplies from the Great Market and from the market in city sector 10. Her clients are men and women.
She wants to purchase five pieces of ‘pagnes’ and some clothes.
She uses her profits to help her husband with the children’s schooling. She ambitions to see her business grow, to travel to neighboring countries to procure products, and to see her children be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy five pagnes (pieces of local fabric) and clothes.

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es: Dionicia, de 52 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive desde hace 34 años junto a Gumercindo, su esposo. Ambos tienen 7 hijos, a los que quieren mucho, pero solo viven con 5 de ellos, en su casa propia, ubicada en Auray. Su principal ingreso económico consiste en la crianza de animales como: ovejas, vacas y alpacas, las cuales cría en la altura, “yo misma me voy a cuidarlos, llevando todo lo necesario para poder vivir en un periodo de tiempo”, comenta. Pero confiesa que lo que más le gusta es la crianza de alpacas, las cuales comercializa en las ferias de la ciudad de Huancavelica; donde le ofrecen buen precio por los mismos. Incluso, algunas veces participó en concursos de animales de calidad, ganando en muchas oportunidades, su esposo se dedica a cuidarlos para seguir participando y conseguir siempre un premio. Maneja un buen capital en ese negocio, la disciplina es su principal arma, pues no disminuye su capital, siendo esto exclusivamente para las alpacas, que es su especialidad. Ahora desea mejorar su ingreso para poder trabajar con tranquilidad. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “San Fernando”, este es el crédito número quince con MFP, y se siente feliz, pues encontró la ayuda que tanto necesitaba, para emprender sus objetivos. Además es responsable en todas sus labores, por ello promete ser puntual en los pagos. Dionicia de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de animales para criarlos, pues en está temporada cuestan menos, comprará crías de alpaca y ovejas.
texts.en: Dionicia is a hard-working 52-year-old woman. She has lived with her husband Gumercindo for the past 34 years. Together, they have seven children whom she loves very much, but only five live with them in their home located in Auray. Dionicia makes a living raising animals like sheep, cattle and alpacas at altitude. "I take care of them myself, doing everything necessary so they can live for a period of time," she says. She confesses she enjoys the alpacas most of all, which she sells at the trade fairs in the city of Huancavelica, offering them at good prices. Sometimes she even enters them in animal competitions and wins on a lot of occasions. Her husband helps to care for the animals so she can keep participating and winning prizes. She manages a good amount of capital with the winnings - and always practices discipline so that the capital doesn't deteriorate - and uses it exclusively on the alpacas, which are her specialty. Now she wants to increase her income so she can work more comfortably. Dionicia belongs to the "San Fernando" loan group, and this is her 15th loan with Kiva partner MFP. She feels happy because she found the help she so needed to reach her goals. As she is responsible for all her work, she promises to be punctual with her payments. Upon receiving your support, Dionicia plans to invest the loan in the purchase of animals like alpacas and sheep, since during this time of year they are less expensive.

loans.use: to purchase alpacas and sheep.

loans.name: Gleydys

texts.es: Gleydys de 25 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de muy decidida y alegre. Convive  con Hidelbrando quien es empleado, pero aun no tienen hijos pues no está en sus planes, queriendo primero superarse personalmente. Ambos habitan una casa de propiedad de su hermana. La actividad que realiza Gleydys es la agricultura principalmente el cultivo de yucas siendo la zona propicia para éste producto, contando con un terreno de 17 hectárea de propiedad de su padre quien le cedió un espacio sin costo para su actividad, buscando nuevas y mejores oportunidades de vida. En la actualidad cuenta con una producción de 2 hectáreas de yuca llegando a vender su producto en los mercados de la ciudad  y en otras ciudades teniendo bastante aceptación y demanda.  Iniciándose hace más de 5 años, y para las labores de mantenimiento del terreno y las cosechas cuenta con el apoyo de más 02 peones que contrata ocasionalmente pagando un jornal de 20 nuevos soles diarios. Considera a su negocio rentable por la demanda y las buenas ganancias que le deja ya que los precios de éste producto subieron debido a la  escasez. Le gusta su actividad ya que le deja más ganancias que el empleo que tenia donde el sueldo era muy bajo, además de estar  cómoda, aprendiendo de sus padres las labores del campo, y viendo los buenos resultados tiene planes de continuar con su actividad y mantenerlo. Este será el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecido por el crédito concedido para continuar con su negocio, y desea seguir contando con ese apoyo, por eso se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en créditos anteriores. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la siembra de más extensiones de yuca al menos de 2 hectáreas, para ello debe contratar peones, planeando incrementar su producción por la demanda que tiene éste producto ya que la tendencia de los precios es mantenerse elevados logrando obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Gleydys is 25 years old and a hardworking and industrious woman. In addition, she is very decisive and cheerful. She lives with Hidelbrando who is employed, but they have no children since that is not part of their plans. Most of all, they want to succeed personally. Both of them live in a house owned by her sister. Gleydys has an agricultural business, primarily growing cassava since this area is suitable for this product. She has a plot of land containing 17 hectares owned by her father, who leased the property to her without cost so that she could farm. Gleydys is looking for new and better opportunities in life. She currently has two hectares that are producing cassava that she will take to the markets in the city to sell. Gleydys also sells in other cities since there is suitable demand. She started farming more than five years ago. In order to maintain the land and harvest the crops, she has the help of two other workers who are hired as needed and paid a salary of 20 PEN each day.

Gleydys considers her business to be profitable since there is demand and her earnings have been good. The price of her product has increased due to shortages. She enjoys this business because she has more income compared to the lower salary earned from her previous job. Gleydys also lives comfortably. She learned how to work in the fields from her parents. Since she has achieved good results, she has plans to continue her business and maintain it. This will be her third loan with the MFP organization and she is pleased to have access to credit. In order to continue her business, Gleydys wants to keep receiving this support. She promises to complete her payments just as she did with her previous loans. The amount of 1000 PEN that she requested will be invested in planting cassava on the additional tracts of land (less the existing two hectares that have already been planted). In order to this, she plans to hire workers. Her goal is to increase production since there is demand for this product. Since the prices tend to stay high, Gleydys will be able to earn more income.

loans.use: to hire workers.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 44-year-old married woman with children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She owns a retail shop, which she started ten years ago by getting capital from her salary, and deals in decorations. The hardships she faces are: customers not paying on time and inadequate capital to purchase stock. 

Her dream is to educate her children, build a permanent home and move her business to a more permanent location. Lucy needs this loan to buy merchandise, like soap and sugar, to sell.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, like soap and sugar, to sell.

loans.name: Peou

texts.en:
Peou is a 39-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and two school-age children in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She was born and raised there on the family farm. She grows rice in the rainy season and besides that, grows bean crops. For additional income, Peou also devotes herself to her fish selling business, with support from her spouse who catches the fish in the Tonle Sap River.

Peou is taking out this loan to purchase bean seeds to sow on two hectares of farmland and to buy sacks of fertilizer for both rice and bean crops. She plans to expand her business in order to increase her output throughout the year.

loans.use: to purchase bean seeds and sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Prum

texts.en:
Prum is 53 years old and a single parent with one single child and three married children, living in Batey district, Kompong Cham. She is in the rice farming business to support her family.

In order to make a sustainable living, Prum would like to borrow some funds from HKL, a partner of Kiva, to purchase cashew nuts in bulk from local villagers to stock at home. She will sell them at a profitable price over the next few months. This investment will allow Prum to improve her standard of living. She will save some money for her last-born child’s education.

loans.use: to purchase cashew nuts in bulk from local villagers to stock at home.

loans.name: Cristian David Duque

texts.es:
Gracias a las enseñanzas que le ha dado su padre acerca de la actividad, Cristian decidió montar su propio negocio de reparación de todo tipo de electrodomésticos y con el cual genera ingresos con los cuales sostiene todos sus gastos y contribuye económicamente en su hogar. Cristian es un joven que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy emprendedor y ponerle mucho amor a los trabajos que realiza, lo que le ha permitido captar una gran cantidad de clientes que siempre buscan su trabajo. Cristian ofrece un servicio que en su municipio no es muy común y del cual no existen muchos negocios similares, lo que le permite tener una gran parte de la demanda del municipio y por ende muy buenas ventas. Los trabajos de Cristian siempre se han caracterizado por ser de muy buena calidad, y esto le ha permitido tener muy buena reputación entre sus clientes, y esto ha su vez le ha permitido ver como su negocio ha crecido poco a poco. Con el ánimo de seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes una buena calidad en sus trabajos, Cristian busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de repuestos para su negocio y a realizar algunas adecuaciones locativas en el mismo.

Cristian espera que su negocio siga creciendo poco a poco y este le siga brindando los ingresos necesarios para su sostenimiento y aportar económicamente en su hogar. Además, Cristian espera tener un gran local donde pueda hacerse más atractivo el negocio para los clientes y de esta manera siga creciendo hasta el punto de poder generar empleo y contribuir a mejorar la calidad de vida a distintas personas.
texts.en:
Thanks to everything his father taught him about repairs, Cristian decided to start his own business fixing all kinds of appliances; the income from the business covers all his expenses and contributes economically to his household. Cristian is a young man who has always been very enterprising, and he puts a lot of care into his work, which has allowed him to attract a large clientele, who seek out his work.  Cristian offers a service that is not very readily found in his town; there are few similar businesses, which means he gets a good part of the work in his town and that he makes very good sales.  Cristian's work is known for its high quality, and he has a very good reputation with his clients, so his business has been growing little by little.  With the aim of offering his clients good quality work, Cristian is seeking a loan so he can buy more spare parts for his business and do some remodelling of his business premises. 

Cristian hopes his business will keep growing and that it will continue to bring in the income necessary to sustain him and bring home money to his family. Moreover, Cristian is looking for a bigger premises where he can make his business more attractive to his clients and thereby keep growing to the point where he can generate employment and contribute to improving other people's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his business and to remodel his business premises.

loans.name: Marine Khachatryan

texts.en:
Marine is 38 years old. She lives in Armash village with her husband and two children. Marine's husband is a  police officer. Her daughter is 16 and goes to school. Marine's son is 18. 

The main source of income for the family is the farm where they cultivate wheat, tomatoes and onions. To start the new agricultural season and cultivate the land successfully, Marine has applied for this loan to get necessary items. With the help of this loan Marine plans to purchase eggplant and tomato seeds and also fuel for agricultural use. 

Successful cultivation of the land will help Marine to gather a rich harvest, and have stable income from its sales, which will mean a prosperous life for Marine' family.

loans.use: to pay for eggplant and tomato seeds and  fuel.

loans.name: Elizabeth Njeri Karonji

texts.en: Elizabeth is 56 years old and a mother of 3 children. She sells used clothes to earn a living. She has been in the business for 11 years and describes her customers as low income earners because they live in slums. To earn extra income she runs a grocery store. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to educate her children and hopes to own a boutique in the future. She has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy used clothes for selling.

loans.use: to buy used clothes for selling.

loans.name: Nasreen Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen bibi is a 30-years-old married woman and by this relationship she has two children: one son and one daughter. Her son works in a computer center earning a monthly wage while her daughter is getting educated from a nearby school. Nasreen’s husband is a laborer and earns a meager income. 

Nasreen bibi went to school until the 8th standard but couldn’t study further due to the poor financial circumstances of her family. She later started learning the skill of sewing and embroidery from her mother. Her skill is now allowing her to pay off the utilities. 

Nasreen has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing business. With the loan, she will buy an electric sewing machine because her current machine is manual which doesn’t allow her to receive as many orders. 

She is very confident that the electric sewing machine will enable her to get more orders and complete them on time.

loans.use: to buy an electric sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim is a 53-years-old married woman and by this relationship she has two children: one daughter and one son. Her daughter reads in the 10th standard while her son is involved in decorative embroidery works.
   
Shamim is a 5th standard passed lady. She wished to study further but unfortunately her parents couldn’t afford her education expenses due to poor financial circumstances. She doesn’t want the same destiny to befall her children and that’s why she is giving her daughter a good education so she can make her future bright and have success in life.  

Shamim’s husband is a vegetable seller. He buys vegetables from vegetable markets and sells to his customers on his four-wheeled cart. He has good clientage and makes good sales. He specifically deals with potatoes and onions which are considered high-demand vegetable among the customers.  

Shamim has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husbands’ business. He will invest the loan in buying potatoes and onions in larger quantities for selling.  Shamim is very confident about the positive financial growth of her husband’s business after the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and onions for selling.

loans.name: Grace Mwihaki Wachira

texts.en:
Grace is 32 years old, married and has 2 children. She has a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. She has been in the business for 2 years and describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. To earn extra income she does tailoring. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Rose Kogo

texts.en:
Rose is a married lady, aged 30 years, and she supports three members of her family. She runs a restaurant in Kapsabet town and has been in operation for a period of 10 years earning a monthly income of about KES 30,000. 

She is servicing her fifth loan with KADET LTD of KES 100,000 with which she intends to purchase new chairs for her business at the cost of KES 100,000. The profits will be plowed back into the business.

Her dream is to prosper in her business and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase new chairs for her business.

loans.name: Acsa Wavinya Kalamba

texts.en: Acsa is 29 years old and married with one child. She runs a grocery store to earn a living. She has been in this business for 3 years and describes her business environment as good because she has many regular customers. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 30,000 Kenya Shillings to buy onions, tomatoes and fruits to sell.

loans.use: To buy onions, tomatoes and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 58 years old, married to Harrison, and blessed with six children aged 12, 10, 9, 8, 6 and 4. She owns rental houses and sells charcoal. She started selling charcoal four years ago and earns a monthly income of about KES 9,000. 

She has requested a loan of KES 10,000 to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. The anticipated profit will aid her in repaying her loan and expand her business. 

Her dream is to one day become a famous entrepreneur as well as to educate her children to higher levels. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Artur Poghosyan

texts.en:
Artur is 28 years old. He lives in Meghry town, in the south of Armenia, with his wife, Sona, and two little daughters, Elen and Mary. Artur has been involved in the agricultural business for 7 years. He breeds pigs and keeps beehives. Artur continually keeps his farm growing, which provides stable income for his family. 

Now Artur wants to develop his beekeeping and increase his income. With the help of this loan he plans to purchase 30 beehives. Artur wants his daughters to have access to high education in the future, so the development of beekeeping and additional income will help him to make savings for this purpose.

loans.use: to pay for 30 beehives.

loans.name: Suraiya's Group

texts.en:
Suraiya is a married woman, and by this relationship she has six children - four sons and two daughters. Three of her sons are involved in different work. Her eldest son is in the loading business, the next to him works with his father in his meat sales business, while her third son works in a grocery store as a salesman. Her eldest daughter reads in a nearby school, while her remaining children are free and don’t do anything. 

Her husband is a butcher by profession. He runs a butcher shop in the community market where he deals with red meat (goat). He sells red meat to his customers and earns income from it. Because of his honest behavior and careful weighing of his product, many customers approach him for buying meat.
 
Suraiya herself is a caring housewife. She spends her time in managing the household work by staying at home. She makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. She has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He will invest the loan in buying goats for his butcher shop so he can sell their meat and increase his sales. Suraiya is very confident about her husband’s business success after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy goats for a butcher shop business.

loans.name: Filemon

texts.es: Filemón, de 52 años es un hombre amable. Vive en compañía de una de sus tres hijas, Talía; a la que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Marcatuna - Huachac. El trabajo constante y sacrificado es lo que consume la mayor parte de su tiempo, “por ello perdí a mi esposa, pero muy pronto recobraré el tiempo perdido”, afirma Filemón. En torno a esa premisa, trabaja con mucha dedicación y sobre todo planificación. La siembra de productos como papa, zanahoria y maíz. Son su principal ingreso económico, sobre todo porque es un hombre responsable. Cuenta que en cada cosecha viaja a la capital del país, donde obtiene una mejor ganancia en la comercialización de sus alimentos. Pero cuando obtiene una cosecha considerable, los mismos comerciantes lo buscan para negociar en el lavadero de zanahoria. Asimismo, tiene 4 vacas, las cuales le brindan un promedio de 40 litros de leche, las cuales comercializa a los productores de queso, manjar, mantequilla  y yogurt. Su mayor deseo es poder coordinar sus actividades, pues desea mejorar la relación de su familia, “que es lo más importante”, afirma. Él pertenece al grupo solidario “los lirios” y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, y se siente feliz, pues encontró la ayuda que tanto necesitaba, para emprender sus objetivos. Además es responsable en todas sus labores, por ello promete ser puntual en los pagos. Filemón de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de semillas de zanahoria, y fertilizantes para su próxima siembra y si le alcanza el dinero; comprará comida balanceada para sus animales.
texts.en:
Filemón, 52 years old, is a kind man. He lives with one of his three daughters, Talía, caring for her in his own house, located in the town of Marcatuna - Huachac. His unceasing work and sacrifice is what consumes most of his time, “ hence, I lost my wife, but very soon I will recover lost time,” Filemón says. Around that premise, he works very hard and above all planning the planting of products like potatoes, carrots and corn. They are his main source of income, and above all he is a responsible man. 

He takes each harvest to the capital city of the country where he gets higher prices on the sale of his food. But when he obtains a considerable harvest, the same buyers seek him out in order to negotiate during the post-harvest washing of the carrots. He also has 4 cows, which give him an average of 40 liters of milk, which he sells to producers of cheese, bakery products, butter and yogurt.

His greatest desire is to be able to coordinate his activities, since he wants to improve his family relationships, “which is the most important thing,” he says.

He belongs to the solidarity group “Los Lirios” (The Lilies) and this is the seventh loan through MFP, and he feels happy, as he found the necessary help to undertake his objectives. He is also trustworthy in all he does, so he promises to be punctual in his payments. 

Filemón, upon receiving your help, will use the money from the loan to buy carrot seeds and fertilizers for the next planting season, and if has enough left he will buy feed for his animals.

loans.use: to buy carrot seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Ana Alicia Sapon Gutierrez

texts.es:
La señora Ana Alicia, tiene 35 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 3 hijos los cuales no estudian,  se dedica a la sastrería , confección de pantalones, chumpas, pantalones, etc., inicio estos trabajo siendo operaria y cuenta con 5 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para prestar sus servicios de molido de mixtamal, ya que va a comprar un molino propios y poder tener otra fuente para sus ingresos familiares.Ya que quiere contar con su negocio propio de molino y mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Ana Alicia is 35 years old. She did not have the opportunity to study. She has 3 children who do not study. She works as a tailor, making pants and jackets and other items. She began this work as a machine operator and has 5 years experience.

She is asking for a loan in order to offer her services as a miller, grinding grains, since she is going to buy her own milling machine in order to have another family source of income. She wants to have her own milling business and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a milling machine

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice, a 33-year-old married mother of four, keeps cattle to earn a living. In this enterprise for three years. Alice describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition. She also farms to earn extra income.

Since joining Faulu Kenya, Alice has been able to provide for her family, and hopes to expand her business in the future. She is now requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy more cows.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Mutua Malyunga

texts.en:
Mutua, a 35-year-old married father of three children, has been earning a living by selling timber in Malindi for the last two years. He earns a monthly profit of KES 20,000.

Introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers, Mutua is requesting his first loan for KES. 30,000 to buy additional timber to sell to his customers. He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for his children.

Mutua's goal is to continue growing his business in order to improve his financial status and provide a stable life for his family.

loans.use: to buy additional timber to sell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is 26 years old, married with one child. She runs a retail shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for 3 years and describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her living standards and hopes to own a wholesale shop in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy maize flour, sugar and rice for sale.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, sugar and rice for sale

loans.name: Norayr Antonyan

texts.en:
Norayr, a 35-year-old entrepreneur from Yerevan, lives with his wife, mother and school-age child. The family's sole breadwinner, Norayr makes gold ware, selling to traders in a city market, who then resell them; he started this enterprise five years ago.

Norayr wants to expand his business and make more gold ware to sell, and so is requesting a loan to purchase more gold. The purchase will result in a larger income, enabling Norayr to increase the family's savings and invest in the further development of his business.

loans.use: to purchase gold.

loans.name: Benson Kairu

texts.en:
Benson is 27 years old, married, and blessed with one child. He owns a general shop in the Baba Dogo area. He has been in this business for the last ten years and gets an income of KES.18,000 per month.

He has good credit history with KADET LTD and is applying for his third loan of KES.80,000 from them, which he plans use to buy stock like sugar, salt, soap, cooking oil, and flour. He will use the extra profit to expand his business.

He hopes to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy stock like sugar, soap, cooking oil, and flour

loans.name: Hin

texts.en:
Hin, age 48, makes a living by selling fish in a local market of Baray district. She is married and has 4 children, three of whom are living under the same roof as her. The fish she sells are caught by her husband from the nearby river called Tonle Sap. 

Hin is taking out a loan to purchase fishing materials for her husband such as a new boat with a motor and fishing materials. For her prospect, she hopes to rebuild a stronger house to provide comfortable living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new boat with a motor and fishing materials.

loans.name: Moses Mutungi  Mbolu

texts.en:
Moses, 29 years old, has been operating a retail shop to earn a living for eight years and employs one person. He also farms to earn extra income. Moses describes his business environment as competitive because many people are involved in the same activity.

Since joining Faulu Kenya, Moses has been able to improve his business and hopes to expand his shop into a wholesale operation in the future. He is now requesting a 40,000 Kenya Shillings loan to buy maize, beans and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Jane Gikundi

texts.en:
Jane is a fifty-four-year-old lady. She is single and a mother of one child. She owns a catering and poultry business. Mary has been in the business for four years now and gets a monthly income of one hundred and sixty thousand shillings. 

This will be Jane’s first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy another oven for efficiency. With the profit that she will get, she wants to buy more broilers (chicken) for layers (egg producers). 

In the future, she wants to be able to invest more in the chicken farming and catering business.

loans.use: To buy another oven

loans.name: Nisreen

texts.en:
Nisreen is a 31-year-old married woman from Al Hussien, Amman, Jordan and a mother of three children.

Nisreen has a home-based beauty salon and she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase equipment needed for her salon. Nisreen is looking to purchase a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase equipment needed for her home-based beauty salon

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 43-year-old married man from Al Hussein, Amman, Jordan and a father of three children. He has a "sarvees" ( a means of transportation like a taxi but more than one person can use it at once) and he is requesting a loan of 1500 JD to do maintenance on it.

Ali is looking to purchase a new "sarvees" so that he can increase his income and purchase his dream house.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his "sarvees"

loans.name: Taghreed

texts.en:
Taghreed is a  conservative person and she is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet so the man in the photo is her husband.

Taghreed is a 32-year-old married woman from Al Hussein, Amman, Jordan and a mother of one child. She sells clothes. She works from her house and is requesting a loan of 600 JD to purchase more clothing for business purposes.

Taghreed is looking to increase her sales volume and purchase a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for business purposes

loans.name: Vahanush Grigoryan

texts.en: Vahanush, 61 years old, lives in Shikahogh village with his pensioner wife. He works at the Shikahogh preserve and is also involved in cattle breeding. Vahanush has applied for this loan to buy three additional cows, a purchase that will help increase his income from agriculture and thereby enable the couple to meet living costs and achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase cows.

loans.name: Joel Kimundi  Muindi
